commit_message:
Retrieve os-extra_specs for Nova flavors

When fetching Nova flavors from the server, we are now also retrieving
the os-extra_spec value.  This contains the flavor's profile.

Change-Id: I3ce6086ef6f9ec9630fe5a1e67a69d2a3d17f772

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 17:27:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix CI (QoS and running func tests against OVS 2.9 fixes)

This is a combination of 2 commits as we need both to unblock the gate
right now. One will fix the CI due to QoS changes in neutron and the
other will make functional tests running against OVS 2.9 since master is
currently breaking those. Both depend on each other so this is the
reason behind of the squash.

Fix CI broke because of QoS interface and neutron DB interface changes

all_rules = qos_rule.get_rules(context, policy_id)
TypeError: get_rules() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given)

qos_rule.get_rules() add a arguments (obj_cls) in this commit:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-94eb611a8a3b29dbf8cd2aa2466a53b9R34

This code results in a DB commit for each operation (get_object/delete_object/update_object):
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-7ed10a69652bc41264bbb5ae42eb8867R526
This led to the port's revision_number increase.

Run tempest release job and functional tests against OVS 2.9

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Change-Id: I4f3df7b98f7cfcea94367f83f055b3db0450e761
Closes-bug: #1750599
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-94eb611a8a3b29dbf8cd2aa2466a53b9R34

This code results in a DB commit for each operation (get_object/delete_object/update_object):
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-7ed10a69652bc41264bbb5ae42eb8867R526
This led to the port's revision_number increase.

Run tempest release job and functional tests against OVS 2.9

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Change-Id: I4f3df7b98f7cfcea94367f83f055b3db0450e761
Closes-bug: #1750599
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix CI (QoS and running func tests against OVS 2.9 fixes)

This is a combination of 2 commits as we need both to unblock the gate
right now. One will fix the CI due to QoS changes in neutron and the
other will make functional tests running against OVS 2.9 since master is
currently breaking those. Both depend on each other so this is the
reason behind of the squash.

Fix CI broke because of QoS interface and neutron DB interface changes

all_rules = qos_rule.get_rules(context, policy_id)
TypeError: get_rules() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given)

qos_rule.get_rules() add a arguments (obj_cls) in this commit:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-94eb611a8a3b29dbf8cd2aa2466a53b9R34

This code results in a DB commit for each operation (get_object/delete_object/update_object):
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-7ed10a69652bc41264bbb5ae42eb8867R526
This led to the port's revision_number increase.

Run tempest release job and functional tests against OVS 2.9

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Change-Id: I4f3df7b98f7cfcea94367f83f055b3db0450e761
Closes-bug: #1750599
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Pass stack's name to overcloud update commands.

Explicitly specify stack's name during minor update.
When overcloud is deployed with other name than 'overcloud',
 several parameters have to be adjusted.

Change-Id: I4f0d74b610083f100018aec17540e6e266d93005
(cherry picked from commit 12d29594e569d5230acb823c50e2939c2082bd46)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 19:11:25.000000000', 'message': "Update for upcoming openstacksdk changes

The resource2/proxy2 migration is finally done, so resource2/proxy2 will
be resource/proxy in the next openstacksdk release.

In the release after that, Profile is going away as are entrypoints
plugins. This handles fixing most of that in a way that should work with
both old and new.

There are two additional places where it is problematic due to profile
in the API. I've left a TODO note there and will send in a followup
patch to handle those.

Change-Id: I0c7145c7726e8a5895451ec4e08ae3bf6f324c7a

commit_message:
Update for upcoming openstacksdk changes

The resource2/proxy2 migration is finally done, so resource2/proxy2 will
be resource/proxy in the next openstacksdk release.

In the release after that, Profile is going away as are entrypoints
plugins. This handles fixing most of that in a way that should work with
both old and new.

There are two additional places where it is problematic due to profile
in the API. I've left a TODO note there and will send in a followup
patch to handle those.

Note: The masakari command doesn't work yet with this fix.

Co-Authored-By: Kengo Takahara <takahara-kn@njk.co.jp>
Change-Id: I0c7145c7726e8a5895451ec4e08ae3bf6f324c7a

commit_message:
bgpvpn: take admin_state_up into account

When admin_state_up is set to False on a port, we need to
stop advertising the corresponding BGPVPN routes.

Change-Id: Idd17d5ef7edc7b1705c0ed25a7cefcd095a1f855
Closes-Bug: 1719597
(cherry picked from commit 6abcac9965e424bc6340f6bdb464e56e7aba27b9)

When re-advertising multiple prefixes with 'attract_traffic' from VRF to the
redirection VRF, the default route is only:
- Advertised when starting to readvertise the first prefix,
- Withdrawn when stopping to readvertise the last prefix.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: Ib7f74aecc8be85cf55b5dcd8eaaaa480be1ecbcb

(cherry picked from commit 21b3fe26749be3e5e0efabfb8dc9679c94e1e860)
"}]
commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: Correct default route handling

When re-advertising multiple prefixes with 'attract_traffic' from VRF to the
redirection VRF, the default route is only:
- Advertised when starting to readvertise the first prefix,
- Withdrawn when stopping to readvertise the last prefix.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: Ib7f74aecc8be85cf55b5dcd8eaaaa480be1ecbcb
Closes-Bug: 1749910
(cherry picked from commit 21b3fe26749be3e5e0efabfb8dc9679c94e1e860)

commit_message:
Fix request version returns value handling error.

The request version is processed in the senlin code, so there are
different return values. The senlinclient should do different things.

Change-Id: I1091377e18e5e57d6c605d42ec40bd5b75625a3b
Closes-Bug: #1750964

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I60f8fa3a7e9a952e74ff5ae44cb2388d09e41de0

use . instead of source.

a credentials file to gain access to user-only or

According to the feedback in ML [1], it looks the advantage of using '.' is for better portability of different linux shell. The advantage of using 'source' is better readability. By looking at this patch, the change is on a devstack plugin script but the devstack itself is assuming a bash shell so I don't think we need the better portability in this case.

use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use “.” to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:

http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 14:39:53.000000000', 'message': "Allow iteration over files dict before template stored

Due to a programming error, the files dict of a template would appear to
contain no items when iterated over prior to them being stored in the
database. (Individual items could still be accessed directly by name.)
Since this is the mechanism by which dictionaries are serialised (directly
or e.g. via items()), this resulted in an empty files dict when trying to
send the data over ReST. (The same is likely true of RPC, but we don't
generally send the files dict over RPC any more.)

Since validation occurs before the template is stored, this meant that we
could not validate a remote stack over ReST.

Change-Id: Ie7433557321c54075ad531def0247fad735d07d9
Closes-Bug: #1739447
(cherry picked from commit b652926eb5bbf8d5895e530474ac96bd3062a874)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow iteration over files dict before template stored

Due to a programming error, the files dict of a template would appear to
contain no items when iterated over prior to them being stored in the
database. (Individual items could still be accessed directly by name.)
Since this is the mechanism by which dictionaries are serialised (directly
or e.g. via items()), this resulted in an empty files dict when trying to
send the data over ReST. (The same is likely true of RPC, but we don't
generally send the files dict over RPC any more.)

Since validation occurs before the template is stored, this meant that we
could not validate a remote stack over ReST.

Change-Id: Ie7433557321c54075ad531def0247fad735d07d9
Closes-Bug: #1739447
(cherry picked from commit b652926eb5bbf8d5895e530474ac96bd3062a874)

commit_message:
use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use “.” to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example ,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
 admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: Ie28a51ff559ee8c4b38b883f2b130eb4aadad538

commit_message:
use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use “.” to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example ,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
 admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: I4887aab49e56730d12165478c33816fde7046ec6

Just a note, the section of the documentation referenced is the coding style, when code is used in the documentation.
This is not a general coding style guide for OpenStack projects.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:42:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I think 'source' is more readable.

commit_message:
workload_stabilization trivial fix

This fix allows to compare metric name by value,
not by object.

Change-Id: I57c50ff97efa43efe4fd81875e481b25e9a18cc6

commit_message:
Remove legacy-devstack-dsvm-py36-updown-fedora-26

Because we are moving to fedora-27, it doesn't make much sense to run
this job, as everything is python3 now.

Change-Id: Icbc1283997c65da2baf9113144bed3f1516edae8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add firewall chain configuration

Adds the ability to specify firewall chains via heat templates.
Additionally newer versions of docker have switched to updating
the FORWARD chain to DROP by default. Neutron needs this to be
ACCEPT by default. This change adds the ability to specify
firewall chains via templates.

Depends-On: Ib75f97748540b9162d76c9c189d3ca7e082b3784
Change-Id: I15ec9216013a1b0b935dcd1f5bc8281348777189
Related-Bug: #1750194

commit_message:
Ensure FORWARD is ACCEPT by default

Newer versions of docker have switched to updating the FORWARD chain to
be DROP by default. This causes issues with the deployment. Update the
FORWARD chains to be ACCEPT by default.

Depends-On: Ib75f97748540b9162d76c9c189d3ca7e082b3784
Closes-Bug: #1750194

Change-Id: I93be7138e6a61cf3aadf19f53097d67469befc17

has anything registered on pypi though, so release job
verification fails for these on trying to validate that

commit_message:
Switch astara release jobs to not use pypi

There were a few astara repos that were setup up with the
publish-to-pypi release job. None of the astara projects
has anything registered on pypi though, so release job
verification fails for these on trying to validate that
openstackci has rights to push up a new release.

This project is basically retired, so the only reason we
need to change these now is to be able to make other
updates to the legacy release deliverable files in the
releases repo, since changes to those files cause validation
to run.

Change-Id: Id2482015c6920670e3cfe19581f35df99f41ab07

commit_message:
Drop old django tests

django 1.8 to 1.10 are incompatible with django 2.0.
We only supports Django >= 1.11 in Rocky and UTs with
Django <= 1.10 are no longer needed.

Conditions using django.VERSION will be dropped in a later patch
only because moving them to this patch causes many merge conflicts.

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: I0611297e70d8e58d53e94635b0b7175d94df195b

commit_message:
Rework base-publish-static jobs using protected

The new protected attribute means that only jobs in the same repo can
inherit from it. Use that on base-publish-static and move the secrets
from the inherited job to it now, it's now safe to have them here.

Since the secrets need to be available to the post-job and are not
available to post-jobs of inheried jobs, use a common post job for all
of these. Move static-special.yaml to static.yaml and set the location
for the publish location for the single previous user of static.yaml.

Change-Id: I3d749adf242eb87895ad10b6f9c4d12859882ac9

subject: Add arm64 min-ready to nl03
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-23 05:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-23 05:23:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\ni have actually applied this manually, and we have a ready arm64 node.  i'm taking the liberty of applying this here to keep things consistent"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 05:16:47.000000000', 'message': "Add arm64 min-ready to nl03

The launcher calls self.labelImageIsAvailable when calculating the
min-ready values.  This doesn't work if the launcher doesn't have
entries for that label.

Move the arm64 min-ready into nl03 (and out of nl01) and add a note on
this behaviour.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/nodepool/tree/nodepool/launcher.py#n946

Change-Id: I060af7501a8e1106cea673a99fce332fcda73290
"}]
commit_message:
Add arm64 min-ready to nl03

The launcher calls self.labelImageIsAvailable when calculating the
min-ready values.  This doesn't work if the launcher doesn't have
entries for that label.

Move the arm64 min-ready into nl03 (and out of nl01) and add a note on
this behaviour.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/nodepool/tree/nodepool/launcher.py#n946

Change-Id: I060af7501a8e1106cea673a99fce332fcda73290

commit_message:
Use random name in tempest tests

In the tempest tests, we use a fixed name for
security groups and containers. A better approach
is to use a random name.

Change-Id: Ia6334f508a5cefe3c7375d56179620088f7f89a2
Closes-Bug: #1748364

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I12d9b74d2a5be9d9b28b2b014fd05716f5946e72

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 20:55:21.000000000', 'message': "Add missing env vars from unit test job

This commit fixes an oversight in the tox job definitions for unit
tests. Because for better or worse we still use oslotest as the base
test class for tempest's unit tests the stdout, stderr, and logging
capture fixtures are only enabled by an env var. We were never setting
that, so these things weren't captured. This commit fixes the oversight
to enable the capture of these once again.

Change-Id: I81e4077dfda9e9a8a8001f52955ab0164f39d31d
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing env vars from unit test job

This commit fixes an oversight in the tox job definitions for unit
tests. Because for better or worse we still use oslotest as the base
test class for tempest's unit tests the stdout, stderr, and logging
capture fixtures are only enabled by an env var. We were never setting
that, so these things weren't captured. This commit fixes the oversight
to enable the capture of these once again.

Change-Id: I81e4077dfda9e9a8a8001f52955ab0164f39d31d

This change is not changing the fact whether 1.0 version of deletion policy, for example, is supported.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-02-09 12:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

setup.cfg was add delete 1.0 version support.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-09 13:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-02-09 22:57:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If the goal is to support multiple versions of a policy like deletion-1.0 and deletion-1.1, can't we just keep both deletion policy modules with different names in senlin/policies/deletion_policy.py?

For example it could like the code here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543049/

Of course all the existing policy modules need to be renamed to include the version number."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-10 11:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Duc, I agree that having separate classes for different versions could be a better solution.
This one is a workaround.'}, {'account_id': 17656, 'date': '2018-02-11 06:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23314, 'date': '2018-02-11 07:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2018-02-11 12:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17656, 'date': '2018-02-23 02:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

'}, {'created': '2017-11-28 20:51:50.000000000', 'message': 'Move Tempest CLI from testr to stestr

This commit switches the Tempest CLI commands to internally use stestr
instead of testrepository. At this point in time the testrepository
project is effectively unmaintained and stestr was a fork started to
have an actively maintained test runner. It also focuses on being a
dedicated python test runner, instead of an abstract test runner
interface for any tests that emit subunit.

Besides the bug fixes and other improvements included with stestr, this
switch provides a number of advantages for tempest. Primarily stestr has
a real python API for invoking the test runner directly from python. This
means we can simplify the wrapper code to simply call a function instead
of building out a set of CLI arguments and passing that to the CLI
processor.

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Treinish <mtreinish@kortar.org>

Change-Id: I6f5fa7796c576b71c4a0dde66896974a8039a848
'}, {'created': '2017-11-28 21:39:41.000000000', 'message': 'Switch Tempest CLI commands from testrepository to stestr

commit_message:
Switch Tempest CLI commands from testrepository to stestr

This commit switches the Tempest CLI commands to internally use stestr
instead of testrepository. At this point in time the testrepository
project is effectively unmaintained and stestr was a fork started to
have an actively maintained test runner. It also focuses on being a
dedicated python test runner, instead of an abstract test runner
interface for any tests that emit subunit.

Besides the bug fixes and other improvements included with stestr, this
switch provides a number of advantages for tempest. Primarily stestr has
a real python API for invoking the test runner directly from python. This
means we can simplify the wrapper code to simply call a function instead
of building out a set of CLI arguments and passing that to the CLI
processor.

commit_message:
Drop extra loop which modifies Cinder volume status

There is an existing loop which sets the proper value for status
and attach_status right above, so this is doing nothing other than
changing it to the incorrect value.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/fixtures.py

Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: Iea0c1ea0a699b9519f66977391202956f17aac66
(cherry picked from commit 8cd64670ea23484fd1e1a8883e9841486169363e)

commit_message:
Change 'hpe3par_snap_cpg' to 'hpe3par_cpg_snap'

Wrong parameter name for hpe3par SAN snap CPG configuration in Cinder documentation

Change-Id: I5b2683559582a1bbb10b5b7bcc04115adb476977
Closes-Bug: #1747845

Change-Id: Ie4d053cfc69c14da9d4923f44c183074b6411030

commit_message:
Watcher restarts watching fixed resources

kuryr-kubernetes watcher watches k8s resources and trigger registered
pipeline.

This patch handles restarting watching the exceptable resources
when watch thread has failed.

Change-Id: Ie4d053cfc69c14da9d4923f44c183074b6411030
Closes-Bug: 1750976
Signed-off-by: Eunsoo Park <esevan.park@gmail.com>

-- https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/master/openstackclient/common/utils.py#L114-L145'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2016-05-13 14:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Should we do the same thing for the other formatters so the output is somewhat consistent?  It looks like JSON and YAML already clean up the non-string values.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2016-05-13 17:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

What happens if the complex object actually contains data outside of the ASCII character set? Could you add an example using a unicode string that has some accented characters?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-21 16:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Not every object can be serialized to JSON. The FormattableColumn class tries to address this by letting an application wrap the data values with something that knows how to give a nice machine-readable version or human-readable version. So the application could configure the Value column to have use a FormattableColumn subclass that does this line wrapping in a way that works for that column.

If you come up with a FormattableColumn subclass that can be reused, we could add that to cliff to make it available to all users.'}, {'account_id': 6676, 'date': '2018-02-23 01:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
improve output for non string object in table formatter

previously:

$ aodh capabilities list
+---------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| Field         | Value                                             |
+---------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| alarm_storage | {u'storage:production_ready': True}               |
| api           | {u'alarms:history:query:complex': True,           |
|               | u'alarms:query:complex': True,                    |
|               | u'alarms:query:simple': True,                     |
|               | u'alarms:history:query:simple': True}             |
+---------------+---------------------------------------------------+

after:

$ aodh capabilities list
+---------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| Field         | Value                                             |
+---------------+---------------------------------------------------+
| alarm_storage | {"storage:production_ready": true}                |
| api           | {"alarms:history:query:complex": true,            |
|               | "alarms:query:complex": true,                     |
|               | "alarms:query:simple": true,                      |
|               | "alarms:history:query:simple": true}              |
+---------------+---------------------------------------------------+

Change-Id: Ib494cbf0c8aaf945ad5c12f0a1e0c798587b35ee

This patch makes sure that in any Neutron node, no IPtables rule will be

commit_message:
Remove neutron-managed firewall rules from /etc/sysconfig/iptables

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1541528

We don't want IPtables rules managed by Neutron to be persistent, it can
cause issues when rule are recreated while a namespace doesn't exist.

This patch makes sure that in any Neutron node, no IPtables rule will be
persistent if it contains "neutron-" in the name.

Change-Id: Ife465c2c6739c3cbfb9923ed97f370baa745739c
Related-Bug: #1747960
(cherry picked from commit 3c71c483e3e91d11fa83bfd751d2d8e54fdb4a20)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 07:35:28.000000000', 'message': "More hack around expirer's delete task iteration

This is following the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538171/
to cleanup the code to be more intuitive.

This patch tries to resolve:
- Separate container iteration and object iteration to avoid the generator
  termination with (container, None) tuple.
- Using Timestamp class for delete_timestamp to be consist with other modules
- Change yielded delete task object info from tuple to dict because that
  includes several complex info (e.g. task_container, task_object,
  and target_path)
- Fix minor docs and tests depends on the changes above

Change-Id: Ie82622625d13177e08a363686ec632f63d24f4e9
"}]
commit_message:
More hack around expirer's delete task iteration

This is following the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538171/
to cleanup the code to be more intuitive.

This patch tries to resolve:
- Separate container iteration and object iteration to avoid the generator
  termination with (container, None) tuple.
- Using Timestamp class for delete_timestamp to be consist with other modules
- Change yielded delete task object info from tuple to dict because that
  includes several complex info (e.g. task_container, task_object,
  and target_path)
- Fix minor docs and tests depends on the changes above

Change-Id: Ie82622625d13177e08a363686ec632f63d24f4e9

commit_message:
k8s: allow passing extra options to kube daemons

Define a set of new labels to pass additional options to the kubernetes
daemons - kubelet_options, kubeapi_options, kubescheduler_options,
kubecontroller_options, kubeproxy_options.

In all cases the default value is "", meaning no extra options are
passed to the daemons.

Change-Id: Idabe33b1365c7530edc53d1a81dee3c857a4ea47
Closes-Bug: #1701223

subject: [kubernetes] add ingress controller
messages: [{'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-22 22:41:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 20:51:41.000000000', 'message': "[kubernetes] add ingress controller

Add ingress controller configuration and backend to kubernetes clusters.

A new label 'ingress_controller' defines which backend should serve
ingress, with traefik added as the only option for now.

It is defined as a DaemonSet, with instances on all nodes defined with a
certain role. This role is set as an additional cluster label
'ingress_controller_role', with a default value of 'ingress'.

For now no node is automatically set with this role, with users or operators
having to do this manually after cluster creation.

Change-Id: I5175cf91f37e2988dc3d33042558d994810842f3
Closes-Bug: #1738808
(cherry picked from commit 0b18989a50ec7c7323d23f5e84c94dda70363fba)
"}]
commit_message:
[kubernetes] add ingress controller

Add ingress controller configuration and backend to kubernetes clusters.

A new label 'ingress_controller' defines which backend should serve
ingress, with traefik added as the only option for now.

It is defined as a DaemonSet, with instances on all nodes defined with a
certain role. This role is set as an additional cluster label
'ingress_controller_role', with a default value of 'ingress'.

For now no node is automatically set with this role, with users or operators
having to do this manually after cluster creation.

Change-Id: I5175cf91f37e2988dc3d33042558d994810842f3
Closes-Bug: #1738808
(cherry picked from commit 0b18989a50ec7c7323d23f5e84c94dda70363fba)

[{'created': '2018-02-22 20:59:05.000000000', 'message': "Drop unnecessary dependencies from role

The role currently installs debhelper and dh-apparmor which are
not used and cruft from years ago.  It's causing issues with the
UCA Queens repos so removing them fixes the gate and speeds up
installs.

Change-Id: I109e083730774d2eee08e38c7fbc1e48251b09e2
"}]
commit_message:
Drop unnecessary dependencies from role

The role currently installs debhelper and dh-apparmor which are
not used and cruft from years ago.  It's causing issues with the
UCA Queens repos so removing them fixes the gate and speeds up
installs.

Change-Id: I109e083730774d2eee08e38c7fbc1e48251b09e2

messages:

I am not sure how to cover it with tests. it requires some elaborate setup in unit tests, with multiple threads updating same resources (that would give us StaleDataError), and mocking __exit__ for session manager. we originally caught it with api tests, but those are not guarantee that it will hit. add_auto_addrs_on_network_ports raises a retriable exception like
StaleDataError, corresponding IPAllocation is still persisted in the
database without being rolled back and without the corresponding
IpamAllocation model persisted. Later, this situation may break port and
network deletion for resources affected by the issue, failing with the
following error:

Unable to find IP address 2003::f816:3eff:fed2:5006 on subnet
eed623f4-cbad-488c-b230-7f4a8b1514eb

IpamAllocation counterparts, the solution is to remove those
dangling IPAllocations manually from the database. (That's of course
assuming they use Neutron DB IPAM plugin in the first place.)

layer, we may need to revisit this code to keep ignore-on-failure
semantics.

commit_message:
ipam: don't commit IPAllocation while IpamAllocation is rolled back

Don't mix old and new session management styles. Mixing them is not
guaranteed to work. The method is not switched to new enginefacade yet,
so stick to the old style. Since OVO create() method already opens a
nested transaction, do nothing in IPAM layer.

This change fixes an issue where sometimes, whenever
add_auto_addrs_on_network_ports raises a retriable exception like
StaleDataError, corresponding IPAllocation is still persisted in the
database without being rolled back and without the corresponding
IpamAllocation model persisted. Later, this situation may break port and
network deletion for resources affected by the issue, failing with the
following error:

Unable to find IP address 2003::f816:3eff:fed2:5006 on subnet
eed623f4-cbad-488c-b230-7f4a8b1514eb

It happens because whenever writer.using context manager exits, and it's
top level manager, it commits the changes to database. Since
writer.using doesn't know that it's being executed in scope of the old
facade .begin() call, it doesn't postpone commitment as needed.

The bug was introduced in Pike as part of the switch to the new
enginefacade (that was never fully completed), specifically by:
I50be115ea69f805b48b02aebe4259ec2c839830e

For existing setups that already have IPAllocation objects without
IpamAllocation counterparts, the solution is to remove those
dangling IPAllocations manually from the database. (That's of course
assuming they use Neutron DB IPAM plugin in the first place.)

Note: If we ever decide to remove nested transactions from OVO base
layer, we may need to revisit this code to keep ignore-on-failure
semantics.

Change-Id: Ic9e146f51d9a120011892828d3a67b0630f4c5ce
Closes-Bug: #1706750

commit_message:
ipam: don't commit IPAllocation while IpamAllocation is rolled back

Don't mix old and new session management styles. Mixing them is not
guaranteed to work. The method is not switched to new enginefacade yet,
so stick to the old style. Since OVO create() method already opens a
nested transaction, do nothing in IPAM layer.

This change fixes an issue where sometimes, whenever
add_auto_addrs_on_network_ports raises a retriable exception like
StaleDataError, corresponding IPAllocation is still persisted in the
database without being rolled back and without the corresponding
IpamAllocation model persisted. Later, this situation may break port and
network deletion for resources affected by the issue, failing with the
following error:

Unable to find IP address 2003::f816:3eff:fed2:5006 on subnet
eed623f4-cbad-488c-b230-7f4a8b1514eb

It happens because whenever writer.using context manager exits, and it's
top level manager, it commits the changes to database. Since
writer.using doesn't know that it's being executed in scope of the old
facade .begin() call, it doesn't postpone commitment as needed.

The bug was introduced in Pike as part of the switch to the new
enginefacade (that was never fully completed), specifically by:
I50be115ea69f805b48b02aebe4259ec2c839830e

For existing setups that already have IPAllocation objects without
IpamAllocation counterparts, the solution is to remove those
dangling IPAllocations manually from the database. (That's of course
assuming they use Neutron DB IPAM plugin in the first place.)

Note: If we ever decide to remove nested transactions from OVO base
layer, we may need to revisit this code to keep ignore-on-failure
semantics.

Change-Id: Ic9e146f51d9a120011892828d3a67b0630f4c5ce
Closes-Bug: #1706750
(cherry picked from commit d4c41071645d0c25485d93886fbc09ca671ea18b)

commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox jobs

Convert all tox jobs to be Zuul v3 native. This uses the shared
openstack-tox as base.

Remove the now unused playbooks.

also switch to telemetry-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: I3da1ca8a55f0bf6953a68cb5dae67218a0792cf5
(cherry picked from commit a8beaeb7e841c4bf6856d44c3f45dcfa37bf61c0)

commit_message:
Set SELinux to permissive mode for tests

The SELinux policy work for CentOS 7 is not yet done, and it is a
tricky process. The gate jobs ran with Permissive mode a couple of
months ago and gate jobs were more stable.

This patch changes the SELinux mode to Permissive for testing.

Change-Id: I861e20ebd74b3b0df92d5832db76de83a9d63398

subject: Delete pods from registry in CNI daemon
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 17:12:31.000000000', 'message': 'Delete pods from registry in CNI daemon

Initial implementation of kuryr-daemon was only adding new pods to the
in-memory registry and not deleting them. While the amount of data is
tiny, it will accumulate over time and in practice be a memory leak. We
should aim to prevent that, especially taking into account most recent
efforts to base health checks on memory usage.

This commit makes kuryr-daemon react to pod deletions with removals of
pods from the in-memory registry.

Change-Id: I45babc325b7a727d6a973717f6653a40503ad991
Closes-Bug: 1750394
(cherry picked from commit 89a8bd08b5f4ba3410d015ae0f71d10cf4f3b885)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete pods from registry in CNI daemon

Initial implementation of kuryr-daemon was only adding new pods to the
in-memory registry and not deleting them. While the amount of data is
tiny, it will accumulate over time and in practice be a memory leak. We
should aim to prevent that, especially taking into account most recent
efforts to base health checks on memory usage.

This commit makes kuryr-daemon react to pod deletions with removals of
pods from the in-memory registry.

Change-Id: I45babc325b7a727d6a973717f6653a40503ad991
Closes-Bug: 1750394
(cherry picked from commit 89a8bd08b5f4ba3410d015ae0f71d10cf4f3b885)

commit_message:
Remove v2.0 policies

In queens the v2.0 APIs were removed. This commit removes the
leftover v2.0 policies documented in the sample policy file.

Change-Id: Ibb841bcbc12d0be365ddb2681310a0eee6724782
(cherry picked from commit 8948050c03252853d406ddea157633550cb639e4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 14:28:44.000000000', 'message': "WIP Honor service type aliases from the catalog

We create Proxy objects for each service in service-types-authority, and
we also register those proxy objects on the Connection with each of
those aliases. We're not looking for services in the catalog by alias
though, which is bad for backwards compat.

NOTE: This patch is currently too much - and also is broken. My first
stab at this tried to go to far and deal with version discovery as well.
That's a mistake. For now we just need to make sure we can find services
registered by their old service type alias (such as message/messaging)

Closes-Bug: #1747904
Change-Id: Ib837fcb3e9fc52bfee726208da33ffb107af3789

stab at this tried to go to far and deal with version discovery as well.
That's a mistake. For now we just need to make sure we can find services
registered by their old service type alias (such as message/messaging)

Closes-Bug: #1747904
Change-Id: Ib837fcb3e9fc52bfee726208da33ffb107af3789

commit_message:
Honor service type aliases from the catalog

We create Proxy objects for each service in service-types-authority, and
we also register those proxy objects on the Connection with each of
those aliases. We're not looking for services in the catalog by alias
though, which is bad for backwards compat.

Remove *_api_version as required fields. We should be able to handle not
being there just fine now.

Handle liberty-era neutron

We had a workaround for this in the shade code, but it really should
have been in the CloudRegion code.

The underlying issue here is that neutron didn't have a version
discovery document, and also that neutronclient just hard-coded an
append of v2.0 to the end of the endpoint in the catalog. There's really
no way around also doing an append - but we can do our best to not do
the append unless we need to.

Work around discovery being a bit messy for cinder

Discovery for block-storage is tricky due to project_ids being needed in
the URL still, but the unversioned endpoint in the catalog having no
project_id. Nobody is actually using block-storage yet, so hack it for
the moment until we can figure out a proper solution.

Closes-Bug: #1747904
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/545146
Change-Id: Ib837fcb3e9fc52bfee726208da33ffb107af3789

commit_message:
kuberntes: Disable the scale_manager for scale down

Due to bug #1746510, the kubernetes scale manager needs to be
disabled to not break the scale down command completely. Note, that when
magnum scales down the cluster will pick the nodes to scale randomly.

Related-Bug: #1746510
Change-Id: I8c3505ec6d155323288217e0c8ea54adabdff1c3

Okay, as discussed in IRC [1] this is blowing up because PowerVMDriver.capabilities is a class attribute that's not getting replaced/overridden by an instance attribute when we assign stuff to keys therein.  So test A mucks with the variable at the class level, and by the time test B gets there, it's been changed.

Making this driver init change [2] fixes the issue by creating self.capabilities as an instance var (which masks the class var).

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-powervm/%23openstack-powervm.2018-02-22.log.html#t2018-02-22T18:58:33

commit_message:
stop setting extra capabilities

Only one of the three current disk driver capabilities is also
supposed to be a capability of the virt driver, yet all of them
were being copied onto the virt driver. This corrects that so
that only has_imagecache appears in both places.

It also fixes how we test capabilities, which was a) incomplete and
b) only passing coincidentally for has_imagecache (i.e., not testing
what it intended to be testing). This required making capabilities
an instance property instead of a class property, so that when one
test sets a capability that doesn't bleed over into other tests.

Change-Id: I66928342c9dc8c2735b739d1b96f0d5b187b9e8c

commit_message:
Run etcd and flanneld in a system container

In Fedora Atomic 27 etcd and flanneld are removed from the base image.
Install them as a system containers.

* update docker-storage configuration
* add etcd and flannel tags as labels

Change-Id: I2103c7c3d50f4b68ddc11abff72bc9e3f22839f3
Closes-Bug: #1735381
(cherry picked from commit d95ba4d1fff69df506928339bb9eb3472bb4f3d1)

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change puts responsibility for updating the cache on the apt module
task, this means updating the cache will get retried on failure and no
longer fail silently.

  added.

commit_message:
Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change puts responsibility for updating the cache on the apt module
task, this means updating the cache will get retried on failure and no
longer fail silently.

The changes made include:
- the two apt_repository tasks have their update_cache parameter set to
  no so it is clear where any update happens and there is no unnecessary
  duplication of cache updates.
- the use of retries is removed given the tasks no longer need to make
  use of the network.
- the apt_repository task result variables have been given unique names
  to ensure that the cache is updated if only the galera repository is
  added.

Change-Id: I91b7929113f720bc3c55343c481096657376302f
Partial-bug: 1750656
(cherry picked from commit 7596eaa8898e774e4779417ac8c1fec38f634977)

commit_message:
Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change puts responsibility for updating the cache on the apt module
task, this means updating the cache will get retried on failure and no
longer fail silently.

The changes made include:
- the two apt_repository tasks have their update_cache parameter set to
  no so it is clear where any update happens and there is no unnecessary
  duplication of cache updates.
- the use of retries is removed given the tasks no longer need to make
  use of the network.
- the apt_repository task result variables have been given unique names
  to ensure that the cache is updated if only the galera repository is
  added.

In addition, this cherry-pick separates out the cache update step from
the install task so that the update is not performed for every item.

Change-Id: I91b7929113f720bc3c55343c481096657376302f
Partial-bug: 1750656
(cherry picked from commit 7596eaa8898e774e4779417ac8c1fec38f634977)

Refresh templates (also for Queens)

commit_message:
Admin can now delete clusters in any project

After merging https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531066/

delete clusters and cluster templates as well.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ieb393e1f2e1605fa8337f783994335e6fb64c6b6

commit_message:
Move jenkins/data/bindep-fallback.txt (2/2)

Remove using old location, we can switch now to the new location
everywhere.

Note: We can only merge this after new images are build with the new
location build in.

This needs a recheck once change 1 is in since project-config is
not self-testing. So, we can remove jenkins/data/bindep-fallback.txt in
this change.

Change-Id: I08f23e96defb152946ade1490628f37f0215300d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543141

Rename them for consistency in the form of either
ironic-grenade-{postfix} or
ironic-tempest-{disk type}-{driver}-{postfix}

Strip the name of
- dsvm (makes no particular sense)
- tinyipa (all jobs here use tinyipa)
- ipa (we only have IPA upstream)

The job scripts are purged of shell conditions that are never true.

Note that this change does not touch the job names, only the playbook
names. A separate change will rename the jobs similarly.

commit_message:
Clean up CI playbooks

The job scripts are purged of shell conditions that are never true
and variables that no longer have effect.

The resourceclasses job is removed completely, as all jobs now run
with resource classes.

Change-Id: I66a5e4f5f7214bcf9aeab8ee8d46a323610ff333

[{'created': '2018-02-01 08:30:20.000000000', 'message': "Move zuul_copy_output to be a job variable

The zuul_copy_output variable is designed to be able to be used as
a zuul job variable so that zuul dictionary merging will work. However,
it's currently being set in the playbook rather than as a job variable,
so it's not possible to supplement it in a child job.

Move it to be a job variable. Also remove the wrapping {} as they should
not be needed to make zuul_copy_output a dictionary.

Change-Id: I27da22bd48dbe7252db9f9d22f3087b070fb26ac

commit_message:
Move zuul_copy_output to be a job variable

The zuul_copy_output variable is designed to be able to be used as
a zuul job variable so that zuul dictionary merging will work. However,
it's currently being set in the playbook rather than as a job variable,
so it's not possible to supplement it in a child job.

Move it to be a job variable. Also remove the wrapping {} as they should
not be needed to make zuul_copy_output a dictionary.

Change-Id: I27da22bd48dbe7252db9f9d22f3087b070fb26ac
Depend-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539686/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 17:20:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix Apt cache update due to adding Galera repo

Registering the same variable when adding the Galera and Percona
repositories means that the cache is not updated if the Galera
repository is added but the Percona one isn't. This change gives the
variables separate names to ensure the cache update happens when
required.

Change-Id: Ie754888e2ee97e7455ae1f7328afde0e9a6cb25e
Partial-bug: 1750656
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Apt cache update due to adding Galera repo

Registering the same variable when adding the Galera and Percona
repositories means that the cache is not updated if the Galera
repository is added but the Percona one isn't. This change gives the
variables separate names to ensure the cache update happens when
required.

Change-Id: Ie754888e2ee97e7455ae1f7328afde0e9a6cb25e
Partial-bug: 1750656

[{'created': '2018-02-12 18:44:03.000000000', 'message': "Make connection plugin compatible with Ansible 2.5

Previously, the MAGIC_VARIABLE_MAPPING constant was updated to make
additional OSA required hostvars available to the play_context. In 2.5,
MAGIC_VARIABLE_MAPPING has a different location but updating it is no
longer necessary. Connection plugins are now able to access any hostvars
and options defined within their docstrings. The upstream connection/ssh
plugin's docstring has been copied here with the addition of OSA's
required options.

commit_message:
Make connection plugin compatible with Ansible 2.5

Previously, the MAGIC_VARIABLE_MAPPING constant was updated to make
additional OSA required hostvars available to the play_context. In 2.5,
MAGIC_VARIABLE_MAPPING has a different location but updating it is no
longer necessary. Connection plugins are now able to access any hostvars
and options defined within their docstrings. The upstream connection/ssh
plugin's docstring has been copied here with the addition of OSA's
required options.

Change-Id: I6b1bcd4ec5e9d2701bd26e24e0f7645629ae4f3d

commit_message:
Ignore irrelevant changes for tempest jobs

We don't need to run tempest jobs for irrelevant changes in Neutron.

[{'created': '2017-09-13 17:06:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add tox-linting job to project-config check

We've been missing some linting errors in the ansible modules and such
we've been adding, so it's a good time to turn on linting at the check
stage. Port in some of the logic to ansible-lint the playbooks from
openstack-zuul-jobs.

Also, fix a "bug" in that the flake8 configuration in tox.ini was
exclusively selecting H231 as the only error it would report, so it was
missing the errors in the python modules (such as
submit_log_processor_jobs). Due to this being the case for a long time
(since 2004) limit the more thorough linting to the roles/ and
playbooks/ directories where we'll be adding ansible
plugins/modules/etc.

Fix a couple lint problems in the submit_log_processor_jobs as well.

Change-Id: Idddc3c71ebf6ff4cd292bd757da648f070df8009
Signed-off-by: Jesse Keating <omgjlk@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add tox-linting job to project-config check

We've been missing some linting errors in the ansible modules and such
we've been adding, so it's a good time to turn on linting at the check
stage. Port in some of the logic to ansible-lint the playbooks from
openstack-zuul-jobs.

Also, fix a "bug" in that the flake8 configuration in tox.ini was
exclusively selecting H231 as the only error it would report, so it was
missing the errors in the python modules (such as
submit_log_processor_jobs). Due to this being the case for a long time
(since 2004) limit the more thorough linting to the roles/ and
playbooks/ directories where we'll be adding ansible
plugins/modules/etc.

Fix numerous linting problems found by both the ansible-lint and the
ansible syntax-check.

Disable ansible-lint for now as it will wind up linting roles from other
repos, which have errors currently. Re-enable once fixed, then maybe
consider co-gating those repos with this one.

Change-Id: Idddc3c71ebf6ff4cd292bd757da648f070df8009
Signed-off-by: Jesse Keating <omgjlk@us.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-18 16:40:35.000000000', 'message': "[kubernetes] add ingress controller

Add ingress controller configuration and backend to kubernetes clusters.

A new label 'ingress_controller' defines which backend should serve
ingress, with traefik added as the only option for now.

It is defined as a DaemonSet, with instances on all nodes defined with a
certain role. This role is set as an additional cluster label
'ingress_controller_role', with a default value of 'ingress'.

For now no node is automatically set with this role, with users or operators
having to do this manually after cluster creation.

Change-Id: I5175cf91f37e2988dc3d33042558d994810842f3
Closes-Bug: #1738808

commit_message:
[kubernetes] add ingress controller

Add ingress controller configuration and backend to kubernetes clusters.

A new label 'ingress_controller' defines which backend should serve
ingress, with traefik added as the only option for now.

It is defined as a DaemonSet, with instances on all nodes defined with a
certain role. This role is set as an additional cluster label
'ingress_controller_role', with a default value of 'ingress'.

For now no node is automatically set with this role, with users or operators
having to do this manually after cluster creation.

Change-Id: I5175cf91f37e2988dc3d33042558d994810842f3
Closes-Bug: #1738808

subject: Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail
messages: [{'account_id': 7219, 'date': '2018-02-22 15:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-22 15:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 15:58:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the
apt_repository task registers a change. This means updating the cache
will get retried on failure and no longer fail silently.

Change-Id: I41de2b9a98977bb89de812a9fbc85a9f99d62942
Partial-bug: 1750656
(cherry picked from commit 69729be3d1a24f639a9526e09ed027801442ed8c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the
apt_repository task registers a change. This means updating the cache
will get retried on failure and no longer fail silently.

Change-Id: I41de2b9a98977bb89de812a9fbc85a9f99d62942
Partial-bug: 1750656
(cherry picked from commit 69729be3d1a24f639a9526e09ed027801442ed8c)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Idc5de89c7b7504d067a19c35e41d0c3a0fee24c8

commit_message:
Add support MTU tests in the same network type

Neutron now supports setting MTU when creating and updating
a network, so in tempest we can use same network type for
testing different mtu size.

Change-Id: I328ed3f196498ec597cb06d3684c94719666623f
Closes-Bug: #1742197

setting used for each of the fake compute hosts was accidentally named
'nhost' ('\nhost' was edited poorly), so the setting doesn't actually do

all on the same host and only one hypervisor and resource provider is
created.

With the correction in place, the wait_for_compute function needs to be
updated to be aware of the fact that the hostnames on the compute
services will have a numeric prefix when the fake virt driver is used.

Change-Id: I5e8430d170c0b1c4f195ebe510aff8be59e4a3bc
"}]
commit_message:
Correct configuration setting using NUMBER_FAKE_NOVA_COMPUTE

In Change-Id Ia3843818014f7c6c7526ef3aa9676bbddb8a85ca the 'host'
setting used for each of the fake compute hosts was accidentally named
'nhost' ('\nhost' was edited poorly), so the setting doesn't actually do
anything: you create multiple nova-compute processes they think they are
all on the same host and only one hypervisor and resource provider is
created.

With the correction in place, the wait_for_compute function needs to be
updated to be aware of the fact that the hostnames on the compute
services will have a numeric prefix when the fake virt driver is used.

Change-Id: I5e8430d170c0b1c4f195ebe510aff8be59e4a3bc

(1 comment)

While I played with the test case I found the worrying logs in the run.

After your test start up the source compute the following is visible:
2017-08-29 11:44:01,260 INFO [nova.service] Starting compute node (version 16.0.0)
2017-08-29 11:44:01,275 INFO [nova.compute.manager] Deleting instance as it has been evacuated from this host

So the source host tries to delete the instance after a failed evac. That is a bug.
It is not visible in your test right now because another bug prevents the compute manager to delete the allocation for the instance http://paste.openstack.org/show/619737/

Cheers,

commit_message:
Functional test: evacuate with no compute

Resource allocation test case:
Initiate evacuation when no valid host to evacuate to and
check all resource usages and allocations after.

This testcase uncovered the bug below. Bug is fixed already, so the
test contains asserts that cover the correct behavior.

Related-Bug: #1713783
Change-Id: I4ced19bd9259f0b5a50b89dd5908abe35ca73894

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 15:57:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the
apt_repository task registers a change. This means updating the cache
will get retried on failure and no longer fail silently.

Change-Id: I41de2b9a98977bb89de812a9fbc85a9f99d62942
Partial-bug: 1750656
(cherry picked from commit 69729be3d1a24f639a9526e09ed027801442ed8c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the
apt_repository task registers a change. This means updating the cache
will get retried on failure and no longer fail silently.

Change-Id: I41de2b9a98977bb89de812a9fbc85a9f99d62942
Partial-bug: 1750656
(cherry picked from commit 69729be3d1a24f639a9526e09ed027801442ed8c)

attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the

commit_message:
Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the
apt_repository task registers a change. This means updating the cache
will get retried on failure and no longer fail silently.

Change-Id: I41de2b9a98977bb89de812a9fbc85a9f99d62942
Partial-bug: 1750656
(cherry picked from commit 69729be3d1a24f639a9526e09ed027801442ed8c)

subject: Add StoryBoard filter and tag tools
messages:
[{'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-17 16:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-01-18 11:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

Thanks for the review!
I will also update filter scripts to accept a "filter bugs" option (so both have the same features)'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-01-18 17:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-01-18 17:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

We can add these scripts here, but it seems like they would also fit pretty well into a storyboard command line tool that would be a good addition to the python-storyboardclient repository. Please give that some thought.

As far as the priority thing goes, we probably want to just view the worklist ordering as the priority, but I don't know how that translates into the filter. Perhaps projects would use tags for that?"}, {'account_id': 16960, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The -1 is because I strongly recommend against writing scripts that use the deprecated global priority field.

In terms of translating worklist ordering to the filter, I think the main thing to know would be which worklists are asserting a priority which the runner of the script cares about. In the webclient worklists that the user is subscribed to are noted on the relevant stories to give some idea of priority, perhaps using the subscriptions of the user running the script would help here?

As for filtering by a specific priority, perhaps the script should do some filtering of the result to show something like "tasks that appear in the top 25% of priority worklists they're in"?

The is_bug part is less urgent, but its worth noting that anyone using the webclient will not get the option of setting that field, so it isn't a very reliable source.

FWIW, I agree that these scripts would also be useful in the python-storyboardclient repo.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:32:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ack, so I will drop the priority filter (that is a given), and the is_bug check (too bad it was nice and easy to check).

We could have a script to filter stories based on whether the story is listed in a worklist (if a project has a "bugs" worklist), but this sounds a bit too specific. Would it be useful? Something like:
  ./bugs-fixed-since.py [...] -sb --start=1.0.0 | \
  ./sb-filter-stories-by-worklist.py <bugs_worklist_id>

On the scripts location, currently these filters work on the output format of bugs-fixed-since.py, so maybe too specific for python-storyboard itself? But if there is interest in similar generic scripts there, we can add them'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-01-22 13:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-01-22 21:19:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think I agree that as long as the processing is based on bug-fixed-since.py, it makes sense to have this outside the storyboard-client repo.  On the other hand, as more projects use storyboard, having scripts in storyboard-client repo that perform this class of tasks for projects in a given storyboard seems perfectly reasonable.

I have no comments on the code: someone more familiar with this repo should probably test and validate: I'm not confident enough of what it should do to +1."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:

commit_message:
Add StoryBoard filter and tag tools

Based on current Launchpad scripts, these scripts allow to add a tag to
stories, filter out stories with a specific tag

Add relevant sections README

Change-Id: Ifa73a5747afaf02d606e0da5ba12cc361e77c822

commit_message:
Services: Set SGs for N-S with haproxy provider

This is continuation of Ie4a53dedf54472394f92fdfacddf0632e33f1f5b and
aims to orchestrate security groups and rules creation to make sure
listeners are available for each LoadBalancer Service. This is done
on-demand in LBaaS v2 driver.

Related-Bug: 1749968
Change-Id: Ie6b3783eff7a21ad602923c32bacc37356664e82
(cherry picked from commit 731d36eccc68fec3eeb0b99f821ae875334464c4)

Services: Set SGs for N-S with haproxy provider

This is continuation of Ie4a53dedf54472394f92fdfacddf0632e33f1f5b and
aims to orchestrate security groups and rules creation to make sure
listeners are available for each LoadBalancer Service. This is done
on-demand in LBaaS v2 driver.

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I4be5a907f06b8b0f4675f2c68149bae754d87c51

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for memcached

This patch adds script for docker health check of memcached service.
The script checks the service using socat.

Change-Id: Icae9acdd6b10b341c1b189872b7ef864d7ea0806
Depends-On: Ibda77a8d041d894f5efac6578e52b11651bca97f

commit_message:
kuberntes: Disable the scale_manager for scale down

Due to bug #1746510, the kubernetes scale manager needs to be
disabled to not break the scale down command completely. Note, that when
magnum scales down the cluster will pick the nodes to scale randomly.

Related-Bug: #1746510
Change-Id: I8c3505ec6d155323288217e0c8ea54adabdff1c3

commit_message:
k8s: allow passing extra options to kube daemons

Define a set of new labels to pass additional options to the kubernetes
daemons - kubelet_options, kubeapi_options, kubescheduler_options,
kubecontroller_options, kubeproxy_options.

In all cases the default value is "", meaning no extra options are
passed to the daemons.

Change-Id: Idabe33b1365c7530edc53d1a81dee3c857a4ea47
Closes-Bug: #1701223

Add healthcheck script for iSCSId

This patch adds script for docker health check of iscsid service.
The script checks the service using socat.

commit_message:
Fix health check for ovn-metadata

The service does not connect to RabbitMQ, but to ovsdb instead.
This patch makes the script check the correct port.

Change-Id: I85fc431c7566c6bb74af2173cd3b92b7bf74424d

Disable them so we can enable hash randomization

commit_message:
Tests: Disable 2 netapp unit tests

These tests do not pass with python
hash randomization enabled, on py2 or py3.

Disable them so we can enable hash randomization
for all other tests.

Change-Id: I338a55d7df298c00c365be6e523ca63a815d8250
Related-Bug: #1715915

commit_message:
Update 'Usage' section in 'doc/source/api_v1.rst'

When I want to get the client with 'Using Identity Service (keystone)
credentials' section, it will throw errors.(usually http 400)
After testing it is found that two variables aare missing:
  - os_user_domain_name
  - os_project_domain_name
Now added them to the document.

Change-Id: Ibdebc7cf0fc017b7eeb378b022ce5cffcd943fb2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 19:40:56.000000000', 'message': 'Intrusive Instance Monitoring through QEMU Guest Agent

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/masakari/+spec/intrusive-instance-monitoring

Currently, Masakari instance monitoring is strictly non-intrusive black-box
type monitoring through qemu and libvirt. There are however a number of
internal instance/VM faults, that if monitored and detected by Masakari,
could be recovered by existing Masakari auto-recovery mechanisms; increasing
the overall availability of the instance/VM. This blueprint introduces the
capability of performing intrusive instance monitoring of VMs, in order to
detect, report and optionally recover VMs from internal VM faults.
Specifically, VM Heartbeating Monitoring via the QEMU Guest Agent.

Change-Id: I2f6e4abd248bf2b05fca5af7364e32d4fe452c31
Implements: blueprint intrusive-instance-monitoring
'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 19:54:05.000000000', 'message': 'Intrusive Instance Monitoring through QEMU Guest Agent

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ica8fc8018ea730d37da447e78fcf875a13dcf218

[{'created': '2018-02-14 13:42:31.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I70db5c809c61d366be3859f4b3578c06beaa02ab

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The change Ida1a9d8761cec9585f031ec25e5692b8bb55661e caused the conflict because Git got confused as it added the tests right in between where the new tests are added as well as some other cells v1 code.  The API had a conflict with a cell = None at the top which is no longer there.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Release not affected.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:42:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Technically Ocata is affected by the same bug, but for different reasons. In Ocata, the compute could create a volume and attach it, but then fail to spawn the guest, and we'd leave the instance in ERROR state, null out the instance.host and not detach the volumes (in compute). So we have that same issue wrt deleting the instance in ERROR state in the API.

Having said that, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545087/ should also fix the volume detach/cleanup issue in compute when server create fails and we have attached volumes."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 16:46:11.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None and vm_state = ERROR which may
have ports and volumes still allocated.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when it may have
ports or volumes allocated.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return. This is
     the "delete while booting" scenario.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR because of a failed build or is
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we expect instance.host to be None even though
     there could be ports or volumes allocated. In this case, run the
     _local_delete routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the
     instance database record.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/api.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/55ea961/nova/compute/manager.py#L1927-L1929

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117
(cherry picked from commit b3f39244a3eacd6fb141de61850cbd84fecdb544)
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None and vm_state = ERROR which may
have ports and volumes still allocated.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when it may have
ports or volumes allocated.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return. This is
     the "delete while booting" scenario.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR because of a failed build or is
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we expect instance.host to be None even though
     there could be ports or volumes allocated. In this case, run the
     _local_delete routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the
     instance database record.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/api.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/55ea961/nova/compute/manager.py#L1927-L1929

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117
(cherry picked from commit b3f39244a3eacd6fb141de61850cbd84fecdb544)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.17

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I3639201553c5f99ab5a77b2e470c8d5bb2ad6b9d
Change-Id: I8771aed49df11d0a3b210e11cd13285912b81efb

commit_message:
Add individual core group for openstack-ansible-os_neutron

In order to allow more delegated authority and distribute the
review/merge responsibilities for the neutron role for OSA,
this patch allows an individual core team to be established
for the repository.

The OSA core team retains core capabilities as a back-stop.

Change-Id: Idaa03246a4dbde0f216e445655b910d1f16d6e2f

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set openstack-infra-multinode-integration-fedora-26 non-voting

This job looks to be broken on fedora-26. dmsimard is currently
working to debug the issue, but until then make it non-voting.

Change-Id: Ibe6f1789c52a850fab13c014fa3727bc6659af17
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Allow Galera package downloads over HTTP
messages:
[{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-20 21:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-21 09:25:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think changing the default is a good idea. If this is test-related then better options are:

1. Set an override in the AIO configuration.
2. Implement a reverse proxy for the repo inside infra, then override in the AIO config to use it."}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:25:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This affects tests and production deployments. The other distributions use the HTTP mirrors which allows the repo server's apt-cacher-ng to cache the downloads. CentOS uses an HTTPS mirror for some reason.

Using HTTP isn't an issue since the package integrity is verified as soon as the download is complete. If the package is altered during the download, rpm will reject the installation."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Okie dokey - makes sense to me then.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Oh very interesting'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 4f3f04eeed0dec258f15b6ec3619001ce4288ae8'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 21:21:13.000000000', 'message': 'Allow Galera package downloads over HTTP

CentOS has a repo configured for MariaDB that uses HTTPS and this
prevents the repo server from caching the MariaDB packages. That
causes significant delays during CentOS 7 deployments/gates since
those packages are quite large.

This patch changes the MariaDB mirror URL for CentOS to use HTTP.

Closes-Bug: 1750665
Change-Id: I2071b0690778669a81770630f25c3dbfa567c818
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Galera package downloads over HTTP

CentOS has a repo configured for MariaDB that uses HTTPS and this
prevents the repo server from caching the MariaDB packages. That
causes significant delays during CentOS 7 deployments/gates since
those packages are quite large.

This patch changes the MariaDB mirror URL for CentOS to use HTTP.

Closes-Bug: 1750665
Change-Id: I2071b0690778669a81770630f25c3dbfa567c818

commit_message:
Allow Galera package downloads over HTTP

CentOS has a repo configured for MariaDB that uses HTTPS and this
prevents the repo server from caching the MariaDB packages. That
causes significant delays during CentOS 7 deployments/gates since
those packages are quite large.

This patch changes the MariaDB mirror URL for CentOS to use HTTP.

Closes-Bug: 1750665
Change-Id: I2192ade6eb204404fe67d47af063e0e57fbe7d62

commit_message:
Switch notifications for stable branches to match all

With the ability to use regex matching, we can now set one
default stable pattern to match. Since the presence of old
deleted branches are still in the config, it would appear
projects are not always keeping the individual names up to
date. This switches them all to just match on any stable
branches to get rid of the need to update these each
release.

Change-Id: I747b65a9422d8e254ab690b5390b7bf5cd517f6b

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi/heat support in telemetry integration tests

* use telemetry-tempest-plugin
* Install gnocchi 4.0.2 for the same.
* also fix tox jobs
* also backport configurable granularity
(I31344a9f8938ae9c7875cad76430508dd9fd4539)

Change-Id: Id70acc48bc4786185fe09f41abba62e9385f3f20
(cherry picked from commit 9ec9e3c1f804e5f3241bb3d44d5bfc274b4985cf)

commit_message:
Admin can now delete clusters in any project

After merging https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531066/
it would be interesting for admin users to be able to
delete clusters and cluster templates as well.

Related-Bug: #1740982
Change-Id: I91f909e8814b86fd5f8b555573238b99b47ffd03
