[{'created': '2018-02-19 18:23:06.000000000', 'message': 'Delete pods from registry in CNI daemon

Initial implementation of kuryr-daemon was only adding new pods to the
in-memory registry and not deleting them. While the amount of data is
tiny, it will accumulate over time and in practice be a memory leak. We
should aim to prevent that, especially taking into account most recent
efforts to base health checks on memory usage.

This commit makes kuryr-daemon react to pod deletions with removals of
pods from the in-memory registry.

Change-Id: I45babc325b7a727d6a973717f6653a40503ad991
Closes-Bug: 1750394
'}]
commit_message:
Delete pods from registry in CNI daemon

Initial implementation of kuryr-daemon was only adding new pods to the
in-memory registry and not deleting them. While the amount of data is
tiny, it will accumulate over time and in practice be a memory leak. We
should aim to prevent that, especially taking into account most recent
efforts to base health checks on memory usage.

This commit makes kuryr-daemon react to pod deletions with removals of
pods from the in-memory registry.

Change-Id: I45babc325b7a727d6a973717f6653a40503ad991
Closes-Bug: 1750394

Replace the all(self.cpool) pattern with self.cpool.waitall(None) for
clarity.

Note, using appropriate timeout value rather than None is still a
TODO.

There is one case where this patch replaces any(self.cpool) with a
call to waitall(None) i.e. before execution proceeded after first
success, now it waits for all.

Change-Id: I88a600f82a13622bcd46e094274ffba70385acf3
'}]
commit_message:
Use cpool.waitall when waiting for all threads

Replace the all(self.cpool) pattern with self.cpool.waitall(None) for
clarity.

Note, using appropriate timeout value rather than None is still a
TODO.

There is one case where this patch replaces any(self.cpool) with a
call to waitall(None) i.e. before execution proceeded after first
success, now it waits for all.

Change-Id: I88a600f82a13622bcd46e094274ffba70385acf3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 07:19:45.000000000', 'message': "Don't hardcode overcloud stack name.

When overcloud is deployed with other name than 'overcloud',
 credentials file(s) would reflect that.
E.g: when overcloud is called 'qe-cloud' credential files are:
  qe-cloudrc and qe-cloudrc.v3
This chage introduces new variable 'overcloud_stack_name'
 (default is 'overcloud') and adjusts paths to credentials files,
to be derived from stack's name.

Change-Id: I75dab2a85d94eb7fd012cd25a3e89720984c25e2
(cherry picked from commit 4af3f29c7d173eba5e099aee03c15f3b26c2593e)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't hardcode overcloud stack name.

When overcloud is deployed with other name than 'overcloud',
 credentials file(s) would reflect that.
E.g: when overcloud is called 'qe-cloud' credential files are:
  qe-cloudrc and qe-cloudrc.v3
This chage introduces new variable 'overcloud_stack_name'
 (default is 'overcloud') and adjusts paths to credentials files,
to be derived from stack's name.

Change-Id: I75dab2a85d94eb7fd012cd25a3e89720984c25e2
(cherry picked from commit 4af3f29c7d173eba5e099aee03c15f3b26c2593e)

commit_message:
upgrade-non-controller.sh script does not support alternative plan names

This patch adds a new parameter to configure the plan name when
executing the "openstack overcloud config download" command.

The default plan is as usual 'overcloud'.

Change-Id: Icf5eb530b44553e3a79f6e0b7859b46ef08cc926
Closes-Bug: 1750338
Resolves: rhbz#1545415

commit_message:
Explain how filters differ for /r_p vs. /a_c

It was noted during review [1] that, despite citing parity as one of the
motivations for this effort, the description and implied semantic of the
`required` query parameter differs between GET /resource_providers and
GET /allocation_candidates.  This edit adds a note to clarify that that
difference is intentional, and briefly explain why it exists.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546009/2/specs/rocky/approved/traits-on-list-resource-providers.rst@31
Change-Id: I2c7ccabf827fa3344a379aaa588e0f12aae491eb
blueprint: traits-on-list-resource-providers

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 09:41:57.000000000', 'message': "tasks: Drop use_percona_upstream variable variable

The 'use_percona_upstream' variable had quite different and conflicting
meanings in the tasks. It's used to either denote that the upstream
packages will be used directly or that the upstream repositories will
be configured on the hosts and then use the packages from these repositories.
However, the packages in both cases are the same so the variable was
pointless in this form. The variable was meant to be used to select between
upstream and downstream repositories for the Percona packages. However,
the way the galera cluster is deployed makes the Percona packages mandatory.

As a result of which, there is really not much point in keeping this
variable around since the only viable way to get the Percona packages is
from upstream. The variable may be restored when distributions start
providing a working combination of galera+percona in the downstream
repositories. This situation mostly applies to Ubuntu and CentOS which
do not provide galera packages in the cloud repositories. On openSUSE
an external OBS repository is used to provide these packages since
there are no upstream MariaDB or Percona repositories.

Partial-Bug: #1654004
Change-Id: I18853707c29955186da5a1f4d6e80bc3012c04f9

commit_message:
tasks: Fix use_percona_upstream variable usage

The 'use_percona_upstream' variable had quite different and conflicting
meanings in the tasks. It's used to either denote that the upstream
packages will be used directly or that the upstream repositories will
be configured on the hosts and then use the packages from these
repositories. However, the packages in both cases are the same so the
variable was pointless in this form. The variable was meant to be used
to select between upstream and downstream repositories for the Percona
packages. Moreover, upstream does not provide packages for SUSE so we
have to exit the deployment if that variable is set.

Partial-Bug: #1654004
Change-Id: I18853707c29955186da5a1f4d6e80bc3012c04f9

commit_message:
Add flavor fetching via Nova API

This patch support for fetching Nova flavors via its REST API.  We're
including all of the necessary pieces including reducer, selector, etc.

Change-Id: I9535fa8254039ef564d62b653934267b2380ce7c
Depends-On: Ic6df58947bb2cb1e183b5c88ed8d287191e5ee07

commit_message:
SUSE: Fix MariaDB development package

The galera_client commit-id Ib270b0fe23de76620491247efc3352fbc6c1e9b5
switched to the upstream MariaDB packages instead of the ones from the
OBS so we need to update the development package in the SUSE variables
file.

Change-Id: I15f993a3f80283f772bbb8ad75311f5117ff7ac0
(cherry picked from commit cf9db9aa41bccae1c1060c361674e8b3539401a7)

commit_message:
Fix invalid Ceph and BlockStorage role template

The roles would get generated with deprecated parameter group, but no
parameter in that group. Heat would then refuse that template.

Change-Id: I526c8177d1a759ae9e48cdb8b94fc2aa7fe3c6fb
Closes-Bug: #1750828

commit_message:
Fix dependency calculation when two fixed IPs under same subnet

Two fixed IPs could be assigned for one port under a same subnet. In
this case there is a bug that calculates dependencies wrongly and
therefore causes the creation of the journal entry failed because there
are duplicate dependencies.

This patch makes sure that when there are duplicate subnets then only
one of those dependencies is returned.

Change-Id: I70e4759e153ae58c0428832940d21ba67c215b7b
Closes-Bug: #1742402

commit_message:
Add extra yaml validations in upgrade tasks.

Extra checks:
 - Check that only tags=['common', 'validate',
  'pre-upgrade'] are accepted.
 - Fail if tags not defined.
 - Fail if 'step|int == ' condition inside 'when'
   is not the evaluated first.
 - Suggest the use of lists to append conditions
   inside 'when'.

Change-Id: I15f6d4cb6f2a13d04580779a93a02daf86f8b412

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 14:53:39.000000000', 'message': "Keep original behavior of `overcloud deploy`

Merging change Ib96f4f5078ec1c45981d051e546bf931d2885ae2 overcloud
deploy by trying to persist user-environment.yaml, but given that we
don't persist user-files directory in that case, it could point to
non-existent files, and by this breaking both `overcloud deploy` and
`overcloud update stack` commands.

We should revert the changes affecting `overcloud deploy`, and only
focus our environment preservation logic on `overcloud update stack`,
so that we make sure we don't break the `overcloud deploy` command in
code freeze period. Also it would be useful to have a stable `deploy`
command as a fallback in case the new `overcloud update stack`
approach misbehaves.

And persisting `user-files` directory might have a side effect of
collecting garbage files over time (no longer referenced from
anywhere), another reason to only do that in the `update` command for
now, not `deploy`. If we implement garbage collection for user-files,
we could start persisting everything for `deploy` too.

Change-Id: I7da71e92af0a6d7ac2d62786d100a1781a4a4fe9
Partial-Bug: #1749700
"}, {'created': '2018-02-20 16:14:32.000000000', 'message': "Keep original behavior of `overcloud deploy`

`overcloud deploy` and `overcloud update stack` try to persist
user-environment.yaml. But we don't persist `user-files` directory, so

means both `overcloud deploy` and `overcloud update stack` commands
are now broken for some cases.

This patch partially reverts the previous changes. The plan
persistence logic no longer affects `overcloud deploy`, and only
focuses on `overcloud update stack`. This way we'll make sure we don't
introduce backward incompatibility to `overcloud deploy` command at
this point. Also it might be useful to have a stable `deploy` command
as a fallback in case the new `overcloud update stack` file
preservation approach misbehaves.

And persisting `user-files` directory might have a side effect of
accumulating garbage files over time (files no longer referenced from
anywhere), which is another reason to only do that in the `update`
command for now, not `deploy`. If we implement garbage collection for
user-files, we could start persisting everything for `deploy`
too. Alternatively we might also do a complete overhaul of how we
approach deployment plan on CLI to sync closer with UI.

Change-Id: I7da71e92af0a6d7ac2d62786d100a1781a4a4fe9
Partial-Bug: #1749700
"}]
commit_message:
Keep original behavior of `overcloud deploy`

Merging change Ib96f4f5078ec1c45981d051e546bf931d2885ae2 made both
`overcloud deploy` and `overcloud update stack` try to persist
user-environment.yaml. But we don't persist `user-files` directory, so
user-environment.yaml could then point to non-existing files. This
means both `overcloud deploy` and `overcloud update stack` commands
are now broken for some cases.

This patch partially reverts the previous changes. The plan
persistence logic no longer affects `overcloud deploy`, and only
focuses on `overcloud update stack`. This way we'll make sure we don't
introduce backward incompatibility to `overcloud deploy` command at
this point. Also it might be useful to have a stable `deploy` command
as a fallback in case the new `overcloud update stack` file
preservation approach misbehaves.

And persisting `user-files` directory might have a side effect of
accumulating garbage files over time (files no longer referenced from
anywhere), which is another reason to only do that in the `update`
command for now, not `deploy`. If we implement garbage collection for
user-files, we could start persisting everything for `deploy`
too. Alternatively we might also do a complete overhaul of how we
approach deployment plan on CLI to sync closer with UI.

Change-Id: I7da71e92af0a6d7ac2d62786d100a1781a4a4fe9
Partial-Bug: #1749700

commit_message:
Add generic method for preserving plan files, use for user-environment.yaml

This should keep the existing functionality, but via a method which
could be generically reused for network and roles files too, and maybe
the plan environment file too.

Partial-Bug: #1749700
Change-Id: I4f721b5aa699c6cc23ccb2de8c841caa6b078b30

[{'created': '2018-02-21 23:07:52.000000000', 'message': "Ensure attachment_id always exists for block device mapping

If an instance is deleted before it is scheduled, the BDM
clean-up code uses the mappings from the build request as
they don't exist in the database yet.

When using the older attachment flow with reserve_volume,
there is no attachment_id bound to the block device mapping
and because it is not loaded from database but rather from
the build request, accessing the attachment_id field raises
an exception with 'attachment_id not lazy-loadable'

If we did a new style attach, _validate_bdm will add the
attachment_id from Cinder.  If we did not, then this patch
will make sure to set it to 'None' to avoid raising an
exception when checking if we have an attachment_id set in
the BDM clean-up code

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
(cherry picked from commit 16c2c8b3ee9d70e928a61ceb1ef5931d40e509a4)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure attachment_id always exists for block device mapping

If an instance is deleted before it is scheduled, the BDM
clean-up code uses the mappings from the build request as
they don't exist in the database yet.

When using the older attachment flow with reserve_volume,
there is no attachment_id bound to the block device mapping
and because it is not loaded from database but rather from
the build request, accessing the attachment_id field raises
an exception with 'attachment_id not lazy-loadable'

If we did a new style attach, _validate_bdm will add the
attachment_id from Cinder.  If we did not, then this patch
will make sure to set it to 'None' to avoid raising an
exception when checking if we have an attachment_id set in
the BDM clean-up code

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
(cherry picked from commit 16c2c8b3ee9d70e928a61ceb1ef5931d40e509a4)

[{'created': '2018-02-21 23:07:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional test for deleting BFV server with old attach flow

When creating a new instance and deleting it before it gets scheduled
with the old attachment flow (reserve_volume), the block device mappings
are not persisted to database which means that the clean up fails
because it tries to lookup attachment_id which cannot be lazy loaded.

This patch adds a (failing) functional test to check for this issue
which will be addressed in a follow-up patch.

Related-Bug: #1750666
Change-Id: I294c54e5a22dd6e5b226a4b00e7cd116813f0704
(cherry picked from commit 3120627d9802ceda46c2db387fec8fbc80700338)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional test for deleting BFV server with old attach flow

When creating a new instance and deleting it before it gets scheduled
with the old attachment flow (reserve_volume), the block device mappings
are not persisted to database which means that the clean up fails
because it tries to lookup attachment_id which cannot be lazy loaded.

This patch adds a (failing) functional test to check for this issue
which will be addressed in a follow-up patch.

Related-Bug: #1750666
Change-Id: I294c54e5a22dd6e5b226a4b00e7cd116813f0704
(cherry picked from commit 3120627d9802ceda46c2db387fec8fbc80700338)

http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions is the conventions for *documentation*. None of these files appear in the documentation.'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2018-02-07 06:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:43:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

This is inconsistent with the style actually used in devstack itself (for which these scripts are plugins). 'source' is clearly easier to read, and the scripts already use bash-isms like $() so they wouldn't work on an original Bourne shell (/bin/sh) anyway. It has been proposed that the guidelines be removed: I00897ab918787b6f6d70fd5a16a7daa6da1b2ae9. This was discussed on the mailing list starting at http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-February/127503.html"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Guidelines were reverted: I00897ab918787b6f6d70fd5a16a7daa6da1b2ae9.'}]

commit_message:
use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use “.” to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example ,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
 admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: Idcf40bf60697e279ff158426736095fb70a56f61

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
messages: [{'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-22 15:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 15:32:04.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: If6762c9947661d7e5f14680c39e0d085229962db
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: If6762c9947661d7e5f14680c39e0d085229962db

commit_message:
Enable neutron dynamic routing agent

Support the neutron dynamic routing agent. A subsequent charm,
neutron-dynamic-routing, will implement the agent. Neutron-api
needs to enable the plugin and install the correct packages.

Change-Id: I2c58bae47f672fe285b7fc59cd13636475d57ed2

commit_message:
Use openstacksdk for most transitive depends

This should get openstacksdk on to people's machines in advance of
porting ansible modules to use sdk directly. It also lets us just use
sdk for all of the transitive depends.

Leave os-client-config as openstacksdk doesn't depend on it and
transitioning to openstack.config is a better task for the rocky cycle.

Change-Id: I6d26785b3aa1fc75fb0ad2d45684d93e9628f61b

commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox jobs

Convert all tox jobs to be Zuul v3 native. This uses the shared
openstack-tox as base.

Remove the now unused playbooks.

also, use tempest-plugin because of I1c02fd88c3d93b511ff4a6b54b668ebd306481a9

Change-Id: I3da1ca8a55f0bf6953a68cb5dae67218a0792cf5
(cherry picked from commit a8beaeb7e841c4bf6856d44c3f45dcfa37bf61c0)

commit_message:
Parameters cleanup

After all parameter forms have been moved to redux-form parameters
logic can be clened up

* Removes updateRoleParameters thunk action
* Remove updateParametersPending and updateParametersFailed as those
  operations are now tracked in parametersForm redux-form state
* Remove unused parameters constants
* Cleanup parametersReducer from handling unused actions
* Remove unused form and isUpdating properties from parameters state and
  parameter immutable definitions
* Update/cleanup tests

Change-Id: I74dd698e6adfbc23b57afc22b90e14a985fb843d

commit_message:
Fix grenade test

Tempest no longer has a .testr.conf file, since it now runs using stestr
instead.[1] This broke the grenade test, because we expect to be able to
edit .testr.conf. Since Tempest is branchless, change to editing the
(similarly-formatted) .stestr.conf instead. This can be easily backported
to stable branches, in contrast to the more comprehensive fix in the
pipeline for master.[2]

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/commit/?id=24a753dcfbbda143254c64e58b06d15f40e78f59
[2] https://review.openstack.org/542629

Change-Id: Ia1457c3639ff707afb5d378f00ba088da0476d9b

commit_message:
Fix grenade test

Tempest no longer has a .testr.conf file, since it now runs using stestr
instead.[1] This broke the grenade test, because we expect to be able to
edit .testr.conf. Since Tempest is branchless, change to editing the
(similarly-formatted) .stestr.conf instead. This can be easily backported
to stable branches, in contrast to the more comprehensive fix in the
pipeline for master.[2]

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/commit/?id=24a753dcfbbda143254c64e58b06d15f40e78f59
[2] https://review.openstack.org/542629

Change-Id: Ia1457c3639ff707afb5d378f00ba088da0476d9b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 21:28:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change puts responsibility for updating the cache on the apt module
task, this means updating the cache will get retried on failure and no
longer fail silently.

The changes made include:
- the two apt_repository tasks have their update_cache parameter set to
  no so it is clear where any update happens and there is no unnecessary
  duplication of cache updates.
- the use of retries is removed given the tasks no longer need to make
  use of the network.
- the apt_repository task result variables have been given unique names
  to ensure that the cache is updated if only the galera repository is
  added.

Change-Id: I91b7929113f720bc3c55343c481096657376302f
Partial-bug: 1750656
"}, {'created': '2018-02-21 10:11:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

The changes made include:
- the two apt_repository tasks have their update_cache parameter set to

- the use of retries is removed given the tasks no longer need to make

- the apt_repository task result variables have been given unique names

Change-Id: I91b7929113f720bc3c55343c481096657376302f
Partial-bug: 1750656
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change puts responsibility for updating the cache on the apt module
task, this means updating the cache will get retried on failure and no
longer fail silently.

The changes made include:
- the two apt_repository tasks have their update_cache parameter set to
  no so it is clear where any update happens and there is no unnecessary
  duplication of cache updates.
- the use of retries is removed given the tasks no longer need to make
  use of the network.
- the apt_repository task result variables have been given unique names
  to ensure that the cache is updated if only the galera repository is
  added.

Change-Id: I91b7929113f720bc3c55343c481096657376302f
Partial-bug: 1750656

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 10:39:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the
apt_repository task registers a change. This means updating the cache
will get retried on failure and no longer fail silently.

Change-Id: I41de2b9a98977bb89de812a9fbc85a9f99d62942
Partial-bug: 1750656
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cache update after initial apt_repository fail

If apt_repository fails to update the apt cache after updating the
configuration, retries don't register there was a change and so no
attempt is made to update the cache by the module on the second attempt.
This failure can result in a failure to install packages.

This change adds an apt module task to update the cache if the
apt_repository task registers a change. This means updating the cache
will get retried on failure and no longer fail silently.

Change-Id: I41de2b9a98977bb89de812a9fbc85a9f99d62942
Partial-bug: 1750656

commit_message:
Run tempest release job and functional tests against OVS 2.9

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Closes-bug: #1750599

Change-Id: Ie631cfebee98a2d2656c9e7f4430792c115ceda8
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add zuul config for new project 'osel'

The 'osel' project, for OpenStack Event Listener, is a new project in
it's infancy that listens for certain types of events and engages
external security auditing services in those scenarios.  This change adds a
zuul template for the project.

Depends-On: Iab43d154296496b3266d05d164780378cc9641e1
Change-Id: I3dec02bc1a6c12af20c84cc6720034e515e93162

commit_message:
Filter Resource Provider List for Traits

Partly for continued parity with GET /allocation_candidates and partly
because we need it for a bug fix, this spec proposes to add the
?required=<trait_list> queryparam filter to the GET /resource_providers
placement API.

Change-Id: I0bf7dad25d1726364b4493f35acf31f0d7306dbe
blueprint: traits-on-list-resource-providers

subject: Python 3 job: disable Swift
messages:
[{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-13 18:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-13 18:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-13 18:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

This may be not needed: swift is already configured with Python 2 by default, but a dependency is missing.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-13 22:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I think you meant W-1...

That is a bit strange, that swift seems to transiently depend on keystonemiddleware but does not enumerate it as a requirement anywhere. (It works on python2 scenario because other services install keystonemiddleware into the shared system python... but on python3 jobs swift stands alone in its own world)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-14 08:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Ups, right, sorry, W-1.

I asked about this on -infra: Swift has minimal dependencies because it can work without keystone. At least now there is a patch to add support for this dependency through extras in setup.cfg: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544121/, but devstack needs a change to use that information.
More details on the IRC logs from this timestamp:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2018-02-13.log.html#t2018-02-13T22:25:34'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-22 15:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is not needed as it is; Swift is already using python 2 but it fails to start because it lacks some dependencies. This issue should be handled in devstack somehow, maybe with swift support for the extra dependencies.'}]

subject: Support configuring grafana local admin username
messages: [{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-02-19 16:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-19 17:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-02-22 15:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 16:59:47.000000000', 'message': "Support configuring grafana local admin username

The grafana local admin username can be configured by overriding
the admin user field in the grafana.ini file. However, this will
fail when kolla-ansible attempts to configure any enabled
datasources for grafana because the local admin password is
hardcoded to 'admin'. This change allows the grafana local admin
password to be configured via group vars so that the correct
username is used when configuring datasources.

Closes-Bug: #1750408
Change-Id: I0962200894f7a0452da1c249a68f9230b6fab13f
"}]
commit_message:
Support configuring grafana local admin username

The grafana local admin username can be configured by overriding
the admin user field in the grafana.ini file. However, this will
fail when kolla-ansible attempts to configure any enabled
datasources for grafana because the local admin password is
hardcoded to 'admin'. This change allows the grafana local admin
password to be configured via group vars so that the correct
username is used when configuring datasources.

Closes-Bug: #1750408
Change-Id: I0962200894f7a0452da1c249a68f9230b6fab13f

commit_message:
Pass stack's name to overcloud update commands.

Explicitly specify stack's name during minor update.
When overcloud is deployed with other name than 'overcloud',
 several parameters have to be adjusted.

Change-Id: I4f0d74b610083f100018aec17540e6e266d93005

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515643 we're going to add a proper
upgrade container step.

For ocata->pike, where this wasn't an issue the new mechanism will
work as well.

Furthermore we get the right tag for the overcloud images as well.

For better understanding look at all the review under the bug's topic.

Depends-On: I468e14d746fd5ab5a51485ee9b907efc44391c56

commit_message:
Set docker and image value to the right value in mixed version.

For pike->master upgrade we need to make sure that docker image
deployment on the overcloud happens using the pike version of the
image. For that [1] provides the right tags.

This review combined with [2] and [3] ensures that containers are
deployed using pike tags and then upgraded.

 - use overcloud_docker_* for deployment
 - use docker_* for upgrade

[1] I468e14d746fd5ab5a51485ee9b907efc44391c56
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540473/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542311/

Change-Id: Id5aca6496403fe98deee549d4e922ec54dfb02d8

commit_message:
Set sphinx-feature-classification own core group

Setting up sphinx-feature-classification to be its own core group.
oslo-core should still be part of this group.

Change-Id: I815d9283ed6a24fcb7501ce8a6086405a07d2ba8

commit_message:
Renamed vitrage_tempest_tests to vitrage_tempest_plugin

In order to add vitrage_tempest_plugin to PyPi and to OpenStack CI system,
it must be named vitrage_tempest_plugin. vitrage_tempest_tests was a
copy&paste mistake.

Change-Id: I574414aba16377cc550111b9bcd627c28f04fc49

subject: Fix idempotent id for heat scenario tests
messages: [{'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-02-22 11:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-22 11:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks Andrea!'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-02-22 13:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 11:31:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix idempotent id for heat scenario tests

Heat scenario test define a Tempest idempotent id, however since
the base class does not inherit from WithAttributes, the id is not
added to the test function, and not displayed when listing or
invoking the id() method.

Fixing that by adding inheritance to testtools.testcase.WithAttributes.

Change-Id: Id3afee4d36a13967f9da11fc1f4c1a0576f0c3fd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix idempotent id for heat scenario tests

Heat scenario test define a Tempest idempotent id, however since
the base class does not inherit from WithAttributes, the id is not
added to the test function, and not displayed when listing or
invoking the id() method.

Fixing that by adding inheritance to testtools.testcase.WithAttributes.

Change-Id: Id3afee4d36a13967f9da11fc1f4c1a0576f0c3fd

commit_message:
Migrate is_extension_enabled to helper module

This commit breaks the is_extension_enabled() helper function out of
the monolithic tempest.test module and puts it in a newly created
helper module tempest.common.skip_utils. The is_extension_enabled
check is useful outside of just test functions (and the requires_ext
skip decorator) and bundling it in the test module makes it more
difficult to consume outside of test code.

Change-Id: I5cc6cf129ae60d7d07a00ff20884094a509c1a01

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-10 15:22:12.000000000', 'message': "Also put tempest's accounts.yaml file in log output

In certain job configurations tempest is configured to run using
credentials from an accounts.yaml file. This file describes the
credentials for a set of different users to enable tempest to run
in parallel without dynamically allocating all the tenants necessary
to isolate the tests against each other. However, in these
configurations we're not copying the credentials file with the other
artifacts from the run. This commit addresses this by copying the
accounts.yaml file if it exists.

Change-Id: Ie6cd50ba291a98b57f0fcc8d1c9c2efd6de1255a
"}]
commit_message:
Also put tempest's accounts.yaml file in log output

In certain job configurations tempest is configured to run using
credentials from an accounts.yaml file. This file describes the
credentials for a set of different users to enable tempest to run
in parallel without dynamically allocating all the tenants necessary
to isolate the tests against each other. However, in these
configurations we're not copying the credentials file with the other
artifacts from the run. This commit addresses this by copying the
accounts.yaml file if it exists.

Change-Id: Ie6cd50ba291a98b57f0fcc8d1c9c2efd6de1255a

commit_message:
Remove tags from upgrade tasks for ptp.yaml.

After merging [0], the step for each upgrade_task
is now handled in a 'when' condition. This patch
changes all the 'tags:' in upgrade_tasks to their
corresponding 'when:' statement.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510902/

Change-Id: I945a50d559c3f01506673099d69013b824721d03

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Closes-bug: #1750599

Change-Id: I3ba45c91d8718330c2bbb174f7b5f6c5484e2b3b
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Run tempest release job and functional tests against OVS 2.9

This patch makes both the functional tests and tempest release
job to run against OVS 2.9 which is the latest release at the
time that stable/queens is going to be released.

This is also fixing the functional tests that currently run
against OVS master branch and currently breaks those.

Closes-bug: #1750599

Change-Id: I3ba45c91d8718330c2bbb174f7b5f6c5484e2b3b
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi/heat support in telemetry integration tests

* use telemetry-tempest-plugin
* Install gnocchi 4.0.2 for the same.
* also fix tox jobs

Change-Id: Id70acc48bc4786185fe09f41abba62e9385f3f20

Hmm, thanks for the fix!

I need to think more about how this affects stack-preview before voting, as won't this make the output (more) innacurate?

When doing stack-preview we expect mandatory parameters to exist (as it's doing a dry-run of create), so in that case, we should probably use the user parameter provided, vs hard-coding 1?

But then template-validate is a different case, because we only care about template correctness, and in that case hard-coding 1 seems reasonable, because the count won't influence the output seen by the user?"}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2016-09-22 09:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck bug 1468583'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-09-22 10:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

[{'created': '2016-09-21 14:57:54.000000000', 'message': "Provide specific preview in stack resources

ResourceGroup and AutoscalingGroup generally require parameters to know
their size. We do need to be able to generate a template during preview
without necessarily knowing it, so let's have a specific callback with
a size 1 in that case.

Change-Id: Ia8764d59a4c1416239b9da689d05a8b1e8891ce7
Closes-Bug: #1626025

commit_message:
Provide specific preview in stack resources

ResourceGroup and AutoscalingGroup generally require parameters to know
their size. We do need to be able to generate a template during preview
without necessarily knowing it, so let's have a specific callback with
a size 1 in that case.

Change-Id: Ia8764d59a4c1416239b9da689d05a8b1e8891ce7
Closes-Bug: #1626025

subject: Expose simple toggle for artifacts location
messages:
[{'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-22 03:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-22 03:30:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is a possible solution, and is nicely future proof. (I don't think anyone would complain if we end up doing a point release which flips the value of ARTIFACTS_DIRECTORY to something else.)

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-22 03:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-22 11:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wonder if we should wait for next week and merge this depending on the answer from mordred (who could not be able to escape during the PTG !)'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-22 14:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Artifacts are stable enough that this patch seems superfluous (even if the artifacts build job changes, the old URLs will still work and host most-likely identical files)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 03:27:04.000000000', 'message': 'Expose simple toggle for artifacts location

Due to infra "stuff", publishing artifacts to the 'sahara' folder on
tarballs.o.o is not possible in the same way it at one time was.

Due to the uncertainty of the situation, users should (at least for
now) be able to choose which directory on that host to pull artifacts
from. They should be able to do so without the need to set a swarm of
environment variables or make their own modifications to the scripts.

Change-Id: I36808306cbed1796bc26f07eaa189cce3afc288f
'}]
commit_message:
Expose simple toggle for artifacts location

Due to infra "stuff", publishing artifacts to the 'sahara' folder on
tarballs.o.o is not possible in the same way it at one time was.

Due to the uncertainty of the situation, users should (at least for
now) be able to choose which directory on that host to pull artifacts
from. They should be able to do so without the need to set a swarm of
environment variables or make their own modifications to the scripts.

Change-Id: I36808306cbed1796bc26f07eaa189cce3afc288f

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for Aodh API

This patch adds script for docker health check of Aodh API service.
The script checks API service using curl.

Change-Id: I2e55b99a3971acf3df722415a50a4f8966e2cd25

commit_message:
Remove neutron-managed firewall rules from /etc/sysconfig/iptables

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1541528

We don't want IPtables rules managed by Neutron to be persistent, it can
cause issues when rule are recreated while a namespace doesn't exist.

This patch makes sure that in any Neutron node, no IPtables rule will be
persistent if it contains "neutron-" in the name.

Change-Id: Ife465c2c6739c3cbfb9923ed97f370baa745739c
Related-Bug: #1747960

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be set by devstack with
local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting

Change-Id: I2c6f3cd67094002c415ce9d1018c0f08d9a2a22f
Related-Bug: #1743688

[{'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-20 19:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

you need two changes as documented in http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html. Please provide both stacked on each other.

This one misses zuul/main.yaml update.

Will this be part of an existing project?'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-02-20 22:29:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-02-20 22:31:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks for taking a look Andreas!  I was taking some time to understand the new Zuul v3 changes, as well as how to properly construct the tests given that osel is golang.  I'll be getting the second change in this evening.

This is a freestanding project, not part of anything else.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-02-20 22:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-21 07:51:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Note that you have voting jobs (in the followup) and will start with an empty repository. Your very first patch needs to setup the repository and add all infrastructure so that the jobs pass.

Also, you can import an existing repository including it's history if
you have one. Once the repository is created, importing is not
possible anymore, changes will have to go through the normal review
process.

If you have a lot of history to import, please use the upstream field
instead of creating a repository and then pushing the patches one at a
time. Pushing a large number of related patches all at one time causes
the CI infrastructure to slow down, which impacts work on all of the
other projects using it. After repo creation the infra team will not
push any content to it; this is your only chance to import directly.

Please confirm that starting with empty repo with voting jobs is fine.

-1 for the pushMerge."}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-02-21 11:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

This is an internal tool that I am outsourcing so my plan has definitely been to take the existing codebase and push it in the first commit so everything is set up from the outset.  But there are some non-public things in the git history so I am not going to push the full history, just commit the existing codebase without the problematic history.  Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-02-21 11:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-21 12:01:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-22 13:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add new project 'osel'

The 'osel' project, for OpenStack Event Listener, is a new project in
it's infancy that listens for certain types of events and engages
external security auditing services in those scenarios.

Needed-By: I3dec02bc1a6c12af20c84cc6720034e515e93162

Change-Id: Iab43d154296496b3266d05d164780378cc9641e1

For this reason, we should merge this in Rocky.

This patch adds script for docker health check of collectd service.
The script uses collectd control tool to list collected values.

Add healthcheck script for Tacker

This patch adds script for docker health check of tacker-server service.
The script checks API service using curl.

commit_message:
Add healthchecks for barbican containers

The barbican-keystone-listener and worker only listen
for the message queue, so the healthcheck reflects that.

This patch only adds healthcheck scripts after the issue
with rdo-kolla-build-integration CI job. For details see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544626

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic0573f6dfe550dd7f5d6bc579b3b06660d4bf1fc

It was discussed and decided [1] that we only want to be pulling down,

providers. Otherwise we'll get e.g. all the *other* compute nodes which

commit_message:
Only pull associated *sharing* providers

It was discussed and decided [1] that we only want to be pulling down,
caching, and passing to update_provider_tree providers associated via
aggregate with the compute node's provider tree if they are sharing
providers. Otherwise we'll get e.g. all the *other* compute nodes which
are also associated with a sharing provider.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540111/4/specs/rocky/approved/update-provider-tree.rst@48

Closes-Bug: #1750084
(cherry picked from commit d2152f309439a9d9b054a481826242ca15f5c93e)

Conflicts:
	nova/scheduler/client/report.py
	nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/test_report_client.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

NOTE(efried): Conflicts due to changes in this series:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/nova+topic:bug/1734625+branch:master

Change-Id: Iab366da7623e5e31b8416e89fee7d418f7bf9b30

commit_message:
Set -q option to ssh in ProxyCommand

The '-q' option of ssh allows to silent the annoying "Killed by signal
1." output while closing the connection.

Change-Id: I3efc2a422c694a561e396b9a9e5fdc95aab8c837

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.2.16

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Id3e577d4a91da09d96f908143bf6204b5973e5a3
Change-Id: I09e08ab52fb8350a2ca5060ddec7b2807ef385c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:11:17.000000000', 'message': 'Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I57aba8bef6b96bf4c5a6b34d8c6a167de93a6f5c
Closes-Bug: #1747453
'}]
commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I57aba8bef6b96bf4c5a6b34d8c6a167de93a6f5c
Closes-Bug: #1747453

Retrieve measurement again, if returned without val f. dimension

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 00:17:26.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0c4323370d62df22b8f21c41dd8af3d40c077353
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0c4323370d62df22b8f21c41dd8af3d40c077353

commit_message:
Driver's name are case sensitive

The network driver and volume driver used in template are case
sensitive, so it would be nice to use the correct case in document
to avoid confusion.

Closes-Bug: #1748307

Change-Id: I1709acbd18a37f5e5987b3a0eb9a0e8b3ac0e42a
(cherry picked from commit 4d395593891e2e5fcb820a18c6491b0a03406bee)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 07:47:11.000000000', 'message': "Refactor expirer's task shuffling implementation

Object-expirer shuffles order of expiration tasks to avoid deleting
objects in a certain container continuously.

To make review for expirer's task queue update patch [1] easy,
this patch refactors the implementation of the shuffling. In this
patch, the shuffling is divided as a function.

The patch [1] will be rebased after this patch merged.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Change-Id: Ibf61eb1f767a48cb457dd494e1f7c12acfd205de
"}, {'created': '2018-01-31 11:09:15.000000000', 'message': "Refactor expirer's task round robin implementation

Object-expirer changes order of expiration tasks to avoid deleting
objects in a certain container continuously.

To make review for expirer's task queue update patch [1] easy,
this patch refactors the implementation of the order change. In this
patch, the order change is divided as a function.

In [1], there will be two run_once methods for legacy task queue
and for general tasks queue. The two run_once methods have similar
implementations. This patch helps to avoid copying codes in the two
run_once methods.

The patch [1] will be rebased after this patch merged.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Change-Id: Ibf61eb1f767a48cb457dd494e1f7c12acfd205de

commit_message:
Refactor expirer's task round robin implementation

Object-expirer changes order of expiration tasks to avoid deleting
objects in a certain container continuously.

To make review for expirer's task queue update patch [1] easy,
this patch refactors the implementation of the order change. In this
patch, the order change is divided as a function.

In [1], there will be two implementations for legacy task queue
and for general task queue. The two implementations have similar
codes. This patch helps to avoid copying codes in the two implementations.

Other than dividing function, this patch tries to resolve:
- Separate container iteration and object iteration to avoid the generator
  termination with (container, None) tuple.
- Using Timestamp class for delete_timestamp to be consist with other modules
- Change yielded delete task object info from tuple to dict because that
  includes several complex info (e.g. task_container, task_object,
  and target_path)
- Fix minor docs and tests depends on the changes above

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: Ibf61eb1f767a48cb457dd494e1f7c12acfd205de

The pip_install role adds several packages to each container and this

commit_message:
Install common packages into container cache

The pip_install role adds several packages to each container and this
is a time consuming process since it runs in each container. This
patch copies those packages into the lxc_hosts role so that each
package is installed only one time into the cache.

This should speed up deployments and testing.

Change-Id: I7793d76c01ff77d963b92e54c762426cfdf94e94

[{'account_id': 5575, 'date': '2017-08-10 13:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-08-10 15:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-08-10 15:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Stable Reviewers:  Please select this for merge.  It is non-invasive.  It adds a parameter for the people that want it, but does nothing by default.  The parameter is an important Security hardening technique used in Kerberos systems.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms674944(v=vs.85).aspx'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2017-08-10 16:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks ayoung!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-10 19:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-keystoneauth-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/29/492529/1/check/gate-keystoneauth-docs-ubuntu-xenial/1e15397//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 32s
- gate-keystoneauth-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/29/492529/1/check/gate-keystoneauth-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/4c9de03/ : SUCCESS in 2m 12s
- gate-keystoneauth-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/29/492529/1/check/gate-keystoneauth-python27-ubuntu-xenial/964463b/ : SUCCESS in 2m 30s
- gate-keystoneauth-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/29/492529/1/check/gate-keystoneauth-python35/64ef51d/ : SUCCESS in 1m 54s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-keystoneauth-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/29/492529/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-keystoneauth-ubuntu-xenial/d79b6e5/ : SUCCESS in 1h 53m 57s'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-08-10 19:12:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please talk with lance and discuss a FFE since this would need to have another KSA release for Pike even though this landed in Master.

With an FFE and general view this should be in the Pike release I'll change to a +2. I am hesitant without the FFE and agreement to the impact of the release of accepting this to Pike stable branch."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-08-10 19:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A patch that adds a configuration options as a backport for pike seems risky. I understand the security hardening aspect, but this should have gone in prior to the release.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-08-10 19:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, seems pretty risky at this point. I would just keep this as an improvement for Queens.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2017-08-11 00:25:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

At this point in the cycle it's Keystone's call to accept this via an FFE or not.  True it's a stable branch but it isn't under stable guidelines until it's released.

It's a now or never scenario as this isn't an option to back port after release."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-08-11 12:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Low risk, and the original submitter got it in long before the deadline...and it sat there.  Insufficient cause for a lesser security setup in a deployment.  Please merge.'}, {'account_id': 23757, 'date': '2017-08-11 13:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20031, 'date': '2017-08-15 11:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-08-17 18:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@ayoung, doesn't matter if someone proposes before the deadline. This needs PTL/Stable team approval (especially introducing new options).

I wont hold this up, but the -1 is my level of comfort without other folks weighing in. PTL *and* an ok from the Stable Core will reverse the -1 and we can land."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2017-08-18 00:59:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> @ayoung, doesn't matter if someone proposes before the deadline.
 > This needs PTL/Stable team approval (especially introducing new
 > options).
 > 
 > I wont hold this up, but the -1 is my level of comfort without
 > other folks weighing in. PTL *and* an ok from the Stable Core will
 > reverse the -1 and we can land.

I had written a comment backing up my previous statement that this was entirely a keystone matter but then I realised I have my mental mapping of keystoneauth as a cycle-with-milestones deliverable with is clearly wrong on many levels.  I thank you all for being polite and not pointing that out :)

So looking at this again it's a clean backport for a user impacting bug at a time when all bugfixes are appropriate [1]. 
Where it becomes messy for me is:

 1) The (minimal) commit message reads like a feature not a bug fix :(
 2) It's hard to really understand the scope of the impact from a deploy base
    to decide it it really warrants a backport (and associated late 3.2.0
    release).  So I'm, appropriately, leaving that to the keystone team to
    decide.
 3) The addition of a new config option which we typically only do for
    security/VMT backports.  The new arg *looks* okay in that it's optional
    and defaults to the value currently hard coded.

So overall these isn't anything in this change that violates the stable policy, but it's very much in the grey area.  So I'm going to somewhat sit on the fence with a +1.

It I've followed the history then this code was originally from October 2015[2]?


[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#support-phases
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/233864/1"}, {'account_id': 5575, 'date': '2018-02-22 12:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The parameter will be available on queens release, no need backport it'}]

commit_message:
Remove the unsupported 'insecure_registry' for >=docker 3.0.0

The argument of 'insecure_registry' for image push has been removed
by this commit (in docker 3.0.0):
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/commit/b180b8770a265e33099bd6da76c3e556a1028491

Actually this argument was marked as deprecated and unfunctional
before this removing.

This commit is to remove this parameter at invoking the push() function
when docker version >= 3.0.0.

Change-Id: Ifa7d304d08a4073dcb1dff751d5a443c112cd377
Closes-Bug: #1746703
(cherry picked from commit ad80bfd0693f61df5bf46a4ba2dbb0a87d3fe6f9)

commit_message:
Remove the unsupported 'insecure_registry' for >=docker 3.0.0

The argument of 'insecure_registry' for image push has been removed
by this commit (in docker 3.0.0):
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/commit/b180b8770a265e33099bd6da76c3e556a1028491

Actually this argument was marked as deprecated and unfunctional
before this removing.

This commit is to remove this parameter at invoking the push() function
when docker version >= 3.0.0.

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: Id84965086443f275495331a2964f67ee12a68666

[{'created': '2018-02-08 18:42:12.000000000', 'message': "Retry creating shard containers until successful

When shard ranges are first found, a corresponding container is
created by a PUT.

Before, if this PUT failed, it was not repeated. That was ok because
eventually the shard range would be cleaved and that would create the
container. Or, an object update redirected to that shard might
autocreate the container. In the latter case the container would have
no sharding metadata, so if for some reason cleaving did not happen,
we'd end up with updates in an orphaned container.

Now, the sharder will repeatedly attempt to create shard containers
until successful, rather than leaving it to be a by-product of later
cleaving. That will at least reduce the variety of states we can
expect to find the shard containers in.

Change-Id: Ief5e28d95cdbc7afe5602ae83e3be4b0cc893faf

commit_message:
Retry creating shard containers until successful

When shard ranges are first found, a corresponding container is
created by a PUT.

Before, if this PUT failed, it was not repeated. That was ok because
eventually the shard range would be cleaved and that would create the
container. Or, an object update redirected to that shard might
autocreate the container. In the latter case the container would have
no sharding metadata, so if for some reason cleaving did not happen,
we'd end up with updates in an orphaned container.

Now, the sharder will repeatedly attempt to create shard containers
until successful, rather than leaving it to be a by-product of later
cleaving. That will at least reduce the variety of states we can
expect to find the shard containers in.

Change-Id: Ief5e28d95cdbc7afe5602ae83e3be4b0cc893faf

commit_message:
Do not use the 3rd argument of yaql groupBy

Due to an incompatible change in yaql, it's hard to use the aggregration
of groupBy as the behavior is completely different depending on the
version. Let's try to not rely on it.

Change-Id: I2887011f6baf4867d422579b116b5e143acf5679
Related-Bug: #1750032
(cherry picked from commit 0ddfff79ee5a5f62bb6de55b873bd16b811905f3)
(cherry picked from commit 677c4c221696b16d10ac80709af4be49e6e334c2)
(cherry picked from commit dcd8a695bedad86f111cf38d204c84ce8d5bfb62)

commit_message:
Set 'initrd' to 'rescue_ramdisk' for rescue with iPXE

The kernel paramter 'initrd' is hard-coded as 'deploy_ramdisk' in iPXE
config template. A rescue ramdisk may fail to boot due to this wrong
paramter. This patch sets this 'initrd' paramter properly to
'deploy_ramdisk' or 'rescue_ramdisk' by adding a new pxe option.

Change-Id: I8ad1223dc289bbe915ee4ca8db66c8f80bf08f15
Closes-Bug: 1749860

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 15:20:55.000000000', 'message': "Move shrinking shard ranges to a 'shrinking' state

Once a shard range has been identified as a donor for shrinking it
should not be used as an acceptor during a subsequent cycle, so change
its state to reflect that it is shrinking.

A shrinking range should still be treated the same as an active range
for the purposes of container listings, until it is deleted
simultaneously with the acceptor taking over its namespace in the root
shard ranges table.

To avoid bleeding details of container backend states to the proxy,
introduce a state alias 'listing' which the proxy can use to
parameterize a GET request for all shard ranges that should be used
when consrtucting a listing.  In the backend this is mapped to
'active,shrinking'.

Change-Id: If1e73b330fe1adecd8539eee976a1aa3d0554261

commit_message:
Move shrinking shard ranges to a 'shrinking' state

Once a shard range has been identified as a donor for shrinking it
should not be used as an acceptor during a subsequent cycle, so change
its state to reflect that it is shrinking.

A shrinking range should still be treated the same as an active range
for the purposes of container listings, until it is deleted
simultaneously with the acceptor taking over its namespace in the root
shard ranges table.

To avoid bleeding details of container backend states to the proxy,
introduce a state alias 'listing' which the proxy can use to
parameterize a GET request for all shard ranges that should be used
when constructing a listing.  In the backend this is mapped to
'active,shrinking'.

Change-Id: If1e73b330fe1adecd8539eee976a1aa3d0554261

[{'created': '2018-02-08 17:36:42.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I1ab4b3fa0e4c9f0cbbf4c09c290f0eb042de4d12
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I1ab4b3fa0e4c9f0cbbf4c09c290f0eb042de4d12

commit_message:
Add support for Octavia resources in Heat

Octavia is already an official LBaaS solution for Openstack
(https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/octavia.html) and
will deprecate the neutron-lbaas extension starting from Queens release.

For deployment support Octavia service for load balancing functionlity,
Octavia related resources instead of LBaaS should be used in Heat template.

Tested in my DevStack environment.

Change-Id: Icc45e0a126c648fbcba4ebcd1bb258d60957f2d6
Closes-Bug: #1748577

[{'created': '2018-02-21 10:45:21.000000000', 'message': 'Using v1.9.3 as default k8s version

Currently, the default k8s version in Magnum is v1.7.4, but based on the
deprecation policy of k8s. It will be deprecated at March 2018, see
https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/independent/create-cluster-kubeadm/
So it would be nice to change the default k8s version to latest.

Closes-Bug: #1750549

Change-Id: I053e50ac879b031c8438a2587a99de44e0360c47
'}]
commit_message:
Using v1.9.3 as default k8s version

Currently, the default k8s version in Magnum is v1.7.4, but based on the
deprecation policy of k8s. It will be deprecated at March 2018, see
https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/independent/create-cluster-kubeadm/
So it would be nice to change the default k8s version to latest.

Closes-Bug: #1750549

Change-Id: I053e50ac879b031c8438a2587a99de44e0360c47

subject: Add disabled_drivers config option
messages: [{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-02-21 10:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9178, 'date': '2018-02-21 13:49:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-22 10:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 10:45:04.000000000', 'message': "Add disabled_drivers config option

The new config option 'disabled_drivers' is designed to address a
typical user case: As cloud provider, I'd like to only provide
some particular drivers, e.g. fedora atomic/k8s and don't expose
any other driver support. With this patch, when user create a new
template which is in 'disabled_drivers'. A BadRequest error will
be returned.

Closes-Bug: #1746961

Change-Id: Ib4c53ffed78a1847b2da9672e6348c88757ad66e
"}]
commit_message:
Add disabled_drivers config option

The new config option 'disabled_drivers' is designed to address a
typical user case: As cloud provider, I'd like to only provide
some particular drivers, e.g. fedora atomic/k8s and don't expose
any other driver support. With this patch, when user create a new
template which is in 'disabled_drivers'. A BadRequest error will
be returned.

Closes-Bug: #1746961

Change-Id: Ib4c53ffed78a1847b2da9672e6348c88757ad66e

commit_message:
Support calico as network driver

Adding calico as Kubernetes network driver to support network
policy of Kubernetes. Network policy is a very important feature
for k8s production use. See more information about k8s network
policy at [1] and [2], as for calico please refer [3] and [4].

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/network-policies/
[2] http://blog.kubernetes.io/2017/10/enforcing-network-policies-in-kubernetes.html
[3] https://www.projectcalico.org/calico-network-policy-comes-to-kubernetes/
[4] https://cloudplatform.googleblog.com/2017/09/network-policy-support-for-kubernetes-with-calico.html

Closes-Bug: #1746379

Change-Id: I135a46cd32a67d73d8e64ac5bbc4debfae6c4568
(cherry picked from commit 838b8daf6eb7670dfb44b5058aba278734f287f1)

Remove leftover call to _create_stestrepository

This method doesn't exist and causes runs to fail.

information.

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Make timeout a parameter in wait_for

In plugin.sh, wait_for has a default timeout. This change allows the
default to be overriden with an optional argument.

Change-Id: I5ec2a0d346fb8cec5a458bb06f0e0437c9da9789

commit_message:
Do not use "y" for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Ie27ea416aabdb882eb8b5b5bf06280e98c51c7e0

commit_message:
Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Ie70ecfaa78542e3e3b9f2387df34f615de3e3768

commit_message:
[Docs] Move Ceph example to user guides

Moving the ceph example into the user guide.
This structure also allows more text content, with for example
a guide for integrating with a ceph cluster deployed outside
OSA, and other ceph integrations (Rados GW for example)

Change-Id: Ib3eb33e23cfc50966b41842a02feeaf21f836450

commit_message:
Replace target_protocol values iscsi, iser with tcp, rdma

Since NVME target driver will be implemented, it's better
to use [tcp, rdma] as values for target_protocol.
In iSCSI, tcp means iscsi and rdma means iser.

Change-Id: I7b9e281811d804232ed7ae0b94e2a4f028e961d9

[{'account_id': 17505, 'date': '2018-01-20 14:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17505, 'date': '2018-01-21 07:12:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The problem is that the leading '/' must not be stripped from the path

This function must return something like:

['/templates/auth/_footer_switch.html', '/templates/auth/_login_page.html', '/templates/auth/_splash.html']

But this the introduced change it returns

['templates/auth/_footer_switch.html', 'templates/auth/_login_page.html', 'templates/auth/_splash.html']

the lack of the leading slashes breaks collectstatic"}, {'account_id': 17505, 'date': '2018-01-21 07:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is why the patch proposes to revert that change. I hope I explained my self.'}, {'account_id': 17505, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Please check the bug on Launchpad. Users confirmed this patch solved the bug.'}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you add steps to reproduce this bug? As I can see right now it returns the same list of files for js files in both cases'}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And set +1 for your patch is a bad practice.'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-02-05 17:58:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Vladslav, without the change, if you run tox -e manage collectstatic, it will fail.'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-02-05 17:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-05 18:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would like Radomir to check this.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-02-05 18:56:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I would fix the code that is failing, rather than revert that patch. I think we can find a way to manipulate those path in a more robust way. I will look into that tomorrow.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-02-07 18:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I restored https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535674/2 instead, I think that was a better approach for this fix.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-22 10:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The bug was fixed in a different approach. Could you abandon this?'}, {'account_id': 17505, 'date': '2018-02-22 10:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

- Update README to point to role's new home on Ansible Galaxy
- update rhsm.conf.j2 template so all options are variables
- cleanup rhsm.conf.j2 template by removing comments and compressing lines
- update README with new variables availble in rhsm.conf.j2 template
- increase memory in RHEL6 test machine to prevent kernel panic
- use different repos for RHEL6 and RHEL7 test VMs

Change-Id: Iebd4a992ea1bf9c393f12d2d73c04011f4fe0603
"}]
commit_message:
Update README, variables, and rhsm.conf.j2

- Update README to point to role's new home on Ansible Galaxy
- update rhsm.conf.j2 template so all options are variables
- cleanup rhsm.conf.j2 template by removing comments and compressing lines
- update README with new variables availble in rhsm.conf.j2 template
- increase memory in RHEL6 test machine to prevent kernel panic
- use different repos for RHEL6 and RHEL7 test VMs

Change-Id: Iebd4a992ea1bf9c393f12d2d73c04011f4fe0603

commit_message:
Remove LVM "shred" volume_clear option

The shred option was deprecated in Newton and has been removed. This
updates the volume wiping instructions to reflect that change and
corrects a few of the referenced URLs.

Change-Id: I251a07525bec5f099220d41fafb1fce3d738e3cb

commit_message:
Upgrade UC and OC using tripleo-upgrade role.

Link tripleo-upgrade [0] role into oooq multinode playbook:

 - Added a containers preparation step for upgrades
 - Call tripleo-upgrade role with the specific parameters set in the
   job featureset.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-upgrade

This keeps backward compatibility.

All the necessary bit for the docker switching repository
configuration will come in a later patch.  Here we just add the step.
The first target of this role being O->P, this isn't yet needed as
docker images are not upgrade in this scenario.

We are introducing a tech-debt here.  We have to refactor the set of
tasks introduced in the playbook to a proper role inside oooq-extra.
This should be done in a following refactor.

Related-Bug: #1749740

implements: blueprint tripleo-upgrade

Co-Authored-By: Sofer Athlan-Guyot <sathlang@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92a1d915441686453ef0b241e4ba151c03595074

commit_message:
[Docs] Move more examples to user guide

This moves the following use cases into the user guides:
- Prod example
- L3 routed example

Change-Id: I30c3d70701eaece4b3ec57a96be270ad01a28bad

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Thanks Raoul.

Ok so the reason it hung for Yurii is the following:
1. A docker update happened and a docker daemon restart got triggered
2. The problem is that at this point the docker service is the new version where as the containers are all running via the /usr/bin/dockerd-current and /usr/libexec/docker/docker-runc-current belonging to the *previous* docker version

The two conditions above seem to be what makes stuff hanging. For example one error that we saw while reproducing this live was the following:
Error response from daemon: Cannot restart container 971ea3b44c5d: updating the store state of sandbox failed: failed to update store for object type *libnetwork.sbState: json: cannot unmarshal object into Go struct field sbState.ExtDNS of type string

So this code is fundamentally okay, but it needs to be amended as following:
A. We need to detect if docker will be updated (just like in the good old openvswitch times, lesigh)
B. If docker rpm is not being updated, the code as is should be fine
C. If docker rpm will be updated we need to
C.1. Shutdown all the containers (step 2 probably)                                                                                                                                            
C.2. Let yum update the docker package at step 3 (tripleo-packages service)                                                                                                                   
C.3. Force a docker service start (just because we don't want to rely on the rpm as that restarts it only if it was started)                                                                  
C.4. Containers will be restarted automatically by the restart=always metaparameter (or by paunch)"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-08 19:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-09 08:45:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-02-09 08:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

So the block approach was abandoned... Why?'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

I would like to help fixing why blocks are not usable here, can you please point me where to check?'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:39:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/541827/7/check/openstack-tox-pep8/1772def/job-output.txt.gz

We'll tackle the xargs stuff if needed once yurii's test runs are okay"}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-14 15:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think that works. LGTM (although I'd better off just stop using docker instead...)

A minor regex nuance tho"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

> > (1 comment)
