 > you
 > > please point me where to check?
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/27/541827/7/check/openstack-tox-pep8/1772def/job-output.txt.gz
 > 
 > We'll tackle the xargs stuff if needed once yurii's test runs are
 > okay

Back to the block stuff, testing the same exact code locally works:

- block:
    - name: fail to grep
      command: grep nonexistent /etc/hosts
      register: reg_cmd
      failed_when: false

    - name: test creation
      command: touch /tmp/test
      when: reg_cmd.rc != 0

    - name: test creation 1
      command: touch /tmp/test2
      when: reg_cmd.rc != 0
  when: true

but the error we look here http://logs.openstack.org/27/541827/7/check/openstack-tox-pep8/1772def/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-08_15_52_59_338160 says that the "when" statement is duplicated, and actually it is not.
Anyone knows if there are limitations of the usable ansible code inside section of the parameters like this one?'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:38:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

In any case, I've checked it with yaml-validate.py and now seems ok."}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:04:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+1

check experimental gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-1ctlr-featureset037-updates-master-nv should run there, although it is not working yet I am told'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 18:34:32.000000000', 'message': "WIP During a minor update make sure docker service has live-restart option

Via Ib3ea6de7f235d2a2d53a6576e0876ab171128b34 we make sure that we
use the --live-restart docker option by default so we can avoid docker
service restarts bringing down the whole control-plane. While this fixes
new deployments, it leaves a problematic window open in case an operator
already deployed pike and wants to do a minor update. In such case, the
change mentioned above will fix things, but might be disruptive at the
very first call: that's because the first docker restart to push the
--live-restart option will trigger a docker restart which will bring
down all containers.

In order to avoid this condition, let's add a check during the minor
update at step 2 in which we add the --live-restart option if it is not
existing already and we restart docker.

It should be safe to do this because at step2 we are guaranteed that the
cluster is down on that node and so the API services will not be
reachable anyway. This way before bringing the cluster back up we have
a docker service which is running with the live-restart option and will
be more resilient in the face of docker service restarts.

Change-Id: Ic08468854ce92e81cd84bd6c86a6b672b5a9d49b
Related-Bug: #1747851
"}, {'created': '2018-02-07 18:50:17.000000000', 'message': "WIP During a minor update make sure docker service has live-restart option

reachable anyway. This way before bringing the cluster back up we have

"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 08:45:58.000000000', 'message': "WIP During a minor update make sure docker service has live-restore option

Via Ib3ea6de7f235d2a2d53a6576e0876ab171128b34 we make sure that we
use the --live-restore docker option by default so we can avoid docker
service restarts bringing down the whole control-plane. While this fixes
new deployments, it leaves a problematic window open in case an operator
already deployed pike and wants to do a minor update. In such case, the
change mentioned above will fix things, but might be disruptive at the
very first call: that's because the first docker restart to push the
--live-restore option will trigger a docker restart which will bring
down all containers.

In order to avoid this condition, let's add a check during the minor
update at step 2 in which we add the --live-restore option if it is not
existing already and we restart docker.

It should be safe to do this because at step2 we are guaranteed that the
cluster is down on that node and so the API services will not be
reachable anyway. This way before bringing the cluster back up we have
a docker service which is running with the live-restore option and will
be more resilient in the face of docker service restarts.

We also add an additional special case if we update the docker rpm.
The reason is the following: when the docker package gets updated
the %post section of rpm will do a 'systemctl try-restart docker' which
will restart the docker daemon. But since we just added --live-restore
the containers will keep on running using certain old docker binaries
(e.g. /usr/bin/dockerd-current and /usr/libexec/docker/docker-runc-current).
We have observed docker commands (like ps) actually hanging in this very
situation (newer docker daemon, but containers running via older docker binaries).
We avoid this by detecting a docker package update and in such case, we
stop all containers at step 2 (cluster is stopped at step 1).

Change-Id: Ic08468854ce92e81cd84bd6c86a6b672b5a9d49b
Related-Bug: #1747851

"}, {'created': '2018-02-19 12:04:55.000000000', 'message': "Improve the minor update of the docker service

Via Ib3ea6de7f235d2a2d53a6576e0876ab171128b34 we make sure that we
use the --live-restore docker option by default so we can avoid docker
service restarts bringing down the whole control-plane. While this fixes
new deployments, it leaves a problematic window open in case an operator
already deployed pike and wants to do a minor update. In such case, the
change mentioned above will fix things, but might be disruptive at the
very first call: that's because the first docker restart to push the
--live-restore option will trigger a docker restart which will bring
down all containers.

In order to avoid this condition, let's stop all docker containers and
the docker service, let's update the docker package and then let's run
apply puppet for the docker profile (which will make sure the docker
service is started).  This simple approach avoids any potential docker
service restarts due to puppet changes.

It should be safe to do this because at step2 we are guaranteed that the
cluster is down on that node and so the API services will not be
reachable anyway. This way before bringing the cluster back up we have
a docker service which is running with the live-restore option and will
be more resilient in the face of docker service restarts.

It can be argued that we should stop all containers and restart docker
only when there is either a docker package update or if puppet will trigger
a restart. Due to the puppet bug [1] it becomes rather hackish to detect
if puppet would restart the resource before actually running it.
That is one reason why in this pass we do it all the time, the other
reason being that paunch might trigger a restart of most services
anyway, so there is not that much point in protecting ourselves in this
part of the code. The control plane in any case is usually largely
unaffected by this, since pacemaker will move all the resources to the
other nodes. In the case of a compute node an operator should be aware
that services might be restarted and that critical workloads should be
migrated to other compute nodes before a minor update.

Updated 7 different controller nodes with this patch and they all worked
correctly
NB: we did hit a race with older docker 1.12 versions see RHBZ#1545356.
    1.13 versions were fine.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

[1] https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-686

Change-Id: Ic08468854ce92e81cd84bd6c86a6b672b5a9d49b
Related-Bug: #1747851

commit_message:
Improve the minor update of the docker service

Via Ib3ea6de7f235d2a2d53a6576e0876ab171128b34 we make sure that we
use the --live-restore docker option by default so we can avoid docker
service restarts bringing down the whole control-plane. While this fixes
new deployments, it leaves a problematic window open in case an operator
already deployed pike and wants to do a minor update. In such case, the
change mentioned above will fix things, but might be disruptive at the
very first call: that's because the first docker restart to push the
--live-restore option will trigger a docker restart while the cluster
is up which will bring down all containers at the wrong time (i.e.
without pacemaker knowing about it)

In order to avoid this condition, let's stop all docker containers and
the docker service, let's update the docker package and then let's run
apply puppet for the docker profile (which will make sure the docker
service is started). This simple approach avoids any potential docker
service restarts due to puppet changes.

It should be safe to do this because at step2 we are guaranteed that the
cluster is down on that node and so the API services will not be
reachable anyway. This way before bringing the cluster back up we have
a docker service which is running with the live-restore option and will
be more resilient in the face of docker service restarts.

It can be argued that we should stop all containers and restart docker
only when there is either a docker package update or if puppet will trigger
a restart. Due to the puppet bug [1] it becomes rather hackish to detect
if puppet would restart the resource before actually running it.
That is one reason why in this pass we do it all the time, the other
reason being that paunch might trigger a restart of most services
anyway, so there is not that much point in protecting ourselves in this
part of the code. The control plane in any case is usually largely
unaffected by this, since pacemaker will move all the resources to the
other nodes. In the case of a compute node an operator should be aware
that services might be restarted and that critical workloads should be
migrated to other compute nodes before a minor update.

Updated 7 different controller nodes with this patch and they all worked
correctly
NB: we did hit a race with older docker 1.12 versions see RHBZ#1545356.
    1.13 versions were fine.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

[1] https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-686

Change-Id: Ic08468854ce92e81cd84bd6c86a6b672b5a9d49b
Related-Bug: #1747851

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Also update test helper to stop using a known racy
and deprecation-warned helper (service_restarted).

Create master-undercloud-pike-overcloud release

create master-undercloud-pike-overcloud releases by default without specifying
tripleo-ci directory

[{'created': '2018-02-14 11:41:56.000000000', 'message': 'Remove support for updates via notifications

Remove support for the notifications method for automatically
creating DNS records in Queens+. This method for achieving Neutron
integration has been superseded both upstream and in the charms. By
removing support for it in Queens we prevent the charm from
attempting to make designate v1 api calls for Queens+ which
is a positive thing given it will have been removed *1

*1 https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/designate/queens.html#critical-issues

Change-Id: Ida107c748646cac621b551fad8290899c04e6b79
Closes-Bug: 1749423
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for updates via notifications

Remove support for the notifications method for automatically
creating DNS records in Queens+. This method for achieving Neutron
integration has been superseded both upstream and in the charms. By
removing support for it in Queens we prevent the charm from
attempting to make designate v1 api calls for Queens+ which
is a positive thing given it will have been removed *1

*1 https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/designate/queens.html#critical-issues

Change-Id: Ida107c748646cac621b551fad8290899c04e6b79
Closes-Bug: 1749423

I'm not sure I understand this completely so just dumping some doubts here...
Eliminating policy file has been a community wide goal for queens (https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/index.html), the recommended practice is to have policy in code (https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html). Senlin has done this and claimed completion of this goal (https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:policy-and-docs-in-code+project:openstack/senlin+status:merged ).

So ... what is the patch doing now? Do we still need `tox -egenpolicy`? What is the usage of the generated yaml file?"}, {'account_id': 21690, 'date': '2018-02-22 08:51:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2018-02-22 09:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2018-02-22 09:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2018-02-22 09:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

NDB Cluster has a constraint on row length (14k vs 65K in InnoDB).So, adjusting few columns sizes which really doesn't require larger sizes."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2017-10-24 11:25:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> > Why not all all columns that are strings are not modified?
 > >
 > > I don't understand how you selected some of them.
 > 
 > NDB Cluster has a constraint on row length (14k vs 65K in
 > InnoDB).So, adjusting few columns sizes which really doesn't
 > require larger sizes.

What is the general rule on this? For new columns when do we need to set it to tiny text?

Does this change affect innodb dbs?"}, {'account_id': 23479, 'date': '2017-11-09 18:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> > > Why not all all columns that are strings are not modified?
 > > >
 > > > I don't understand how you selected some of them.
 > >
 > > NDB Cluster has a constraint on row length (14k vs 65K in
 > > InnoDB).So, adjusting few columns sizes which really doesn't
 > > require larger sizes.
 > 
 > What is the general rule on this? For new columns when do we need
 > to set it to tiny text?
 > 
 > Does this change affect innodb dbs?

For new columns, consider the row size limit and use datatype accordingly. There is no need to force it to TINYTEXT for new columns being added.
For InnoDB, there is no affect. If InnoDb used, original settings will be applied, Please refer the "Depends-On" on how its done.'}, {'account_id': 23479, 'date': '2017-12-12 14:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23479, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2018-02-21 12:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-22 08:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-17 21:29:02.000000000', 'message': 'Enables MySQL Cluster Support for Magnum

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting
in oslo_db from bug 1564110. This allows operators to
select from MySQL (InnoDB) or MySQL Cluster (NDB)
as the storage engine backend. There are only two
tables that need to have their columns auto adjusted
to fit with in the 14k row width limit of NDB, cluster
and cluster_templates. The modifications here will
have zero affect on users of MySQL (InnoDB). Additionally,
this fix will auto adjust those tables in models.py
module to support this enhancement.

Change-Id: Ia0584059f998baf3db4a44bccbb6f6ff8a058ae1

commit_message:
Enables MySQL Cluster Support for Magnum

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting
in oslo_db from bug 1564110. This allows operators to
select from MySQL (InnoDB) or MySQL Cluster (NDB)
as the storage engine backend. There are only two
tables that need to have their columns auto adjusted
to fit with in the 14k row width limit of NDB, cluster
and cluster_templates. The modifications here will
have zero affect on users of MySQL (InnoDB). Additionally,
this fix will auto adjust those tables in models.py
module to support this enhancement.

Closes-Bug: 1691514
Change-Id: Ia0584059f998baf3db4a44bccbb6f6ff8a058ae1
Depends-On: I7f9c830073bf9a30abce0aa4bb55b5c9cf661afe

Thank you for your work on this.  Two items from me:

1. The proposed change applies only to Ocata and later.  If that is indeed the intention, the config option description should include that detail.

2. Support for this goes back to the oldest currently-supported release (Trusty-Icehouse).  As such, it could be enabled for all releases following Icehouse.  I'm neutral on this second item, as new deployments should be Ocata and later.  Be aware that if you do enable it for older releases, the name of the config directive in nova.conf has changed slightly over time."}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:58:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Ryan this is a good point. I don't think there's any harm in making this available in for older versions of openstack.

Looking back at this particular config option in older versions, it doesn't appear that it's changed."}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2017-11-22 16:28:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2017-11-29 11:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Enable support for iscsi multipath connections

Adds new charm config option to enable multipath
connections to iscsi volumes. This is configured
in the [libvirt] section of the nova config.

Since newton, the option has been renamed to
'volume_use_multipath'. To accomodate this,
a newton template has been created.

Change-Id: Ibbf91547c5fc41215873c63219cd83303b1d37cd
Partial-Bug: #1518001

commit_message:
Declare heat-dashboard depends on mox

horizon is now migrating UTs from mox to mock in Rocky.
mox is now disabled by default in horizon/test/helpers.py,
so heat-dashboard needs to declare mox dependency explicitly.

Change-Id: Ie683c26def06d4e2b3aafd378ba207f0fa021044

commit_message:
Bump OpenStack service version

* Bump aodh from 4.0.2 to 4.0.3
* Bump bifrost from 3.1.0 to 3.1.1
* Bump ceilometer from 8.1.2 to 8.1.3
* Bump congress from 5.0.0 to 5.0.1
* Bump glance from 14.0.0 to 14.0.1
* Bump ironic-ui from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2
* Bump monasca-ui from 1.5.1 to 1.5.2
* Bump sahara-dashboard from 6.0.2 to 6.0.3
* Bump ironic from 7.0.3 to 7.0.4
* Bump ironic-inspector from 5.0.1 to 5.0.2
* Bump sahara from 6.0.2 to 6.0.3

commit_message:
Do not use "-y" for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I2990d51e22576ae4c961724c70c79680ea7f217d

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I312380043d3f10da1808de300c087514a1f4bdc2
Closes-Bug: #1693670

commit_message:
Merge create and list pods tests

This commit merges create and list pods test in order to avoid them
failing due to a parallelism where it was checking for an empty pod list
on that namespace but some pods were running at the same time.

Closes-Bug: #1700993
Change-Id: I2e0307065173ea88ac0f5d1d183518c7ead96014

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 18:31:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix error handling in compute API for multiattach errors

Because of the big Exception block in _validate_bdm, the
multiattach-specific errors raised out of the
_check_attach_and_reserve_volume method were being lost
and the very generic InvalidBDMVolume was returned to the
user.

For example, I hit this when trying to create a server from
a multiattach volume but forgot to specify microversion 2.60
and it was just telling me it couldn't get the volume, which
I knew was bogus since I could get the volume details.

The fix is to handle the specific errors we want to re-raise.

The tests, which missed this because of their high-level mocking,
are updated so that we actually get to the problematic code and
only the things we don't care about along the way are mocked out.

Change-Id: I0b397e5bcdfd635fa562beb29819dd8c6b828e8a
Closes-Bug: #1750064
(cherry picked from commit 5754ac0ab3670b47243b2d880aa153a7f42a3ac5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error handling in compute API for multiattach errors

Because of the big Exception block in _validate_bdm, the
multiattach-specific errors raised out of the
_check_attach_and_reserve_volume method were being lost
and the very generic InvalidBDMVolume was returned to the
user.

For example, I hit this when trying to create a server from
a multiattach volume but forgot to specify microversion 2.60
and it was just telling me it couldn't get the volume, which
I knew was bogus since I could get the volume details.

The fix is to handle the specific errors we want to re-raise.

The tests, which missed this because of their high-level mocking,
are updated so that we actually get to the problematic code and
only the things we don't care about along the way are mocked out.

Change-Id: I0b397e5bcdfd635fa562beb29819dd8c6b828e8a
Closes-Bug: #1750064
(cherry picked from commit 5754ac0ab3670b47243b2d880aa153a7f42a3ac5)

commit_message:
Detach volumes when deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling

If the user creates a volume-backed server from an existing
volume, the API reserves the volume by creating an attachment
against it. This puts the volume into 'attaching' status.

If the user then deletes the server before it's created in a
cell, by deleting the build request, the attached volume is
orphaned and requires admin intervention in the block storage
service.

This change simply pulls the BDMs off the BuildRequest when
we delete the server via the build request and does the same
local cleanup of those volumes as we would in a "normal" local
delete scenario that the instance was created in a cell but
doesn't have a host.

We don't have to worry about ports in this scenario since
ports are created on the compute, in a cell, and if we're
deleting a build request then we never got far enough to
create ports.

Change-Id: I1a576bdb16befabe06a9728d7adf008fc0667077
Partial-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit 0652e4ab3d506ea21f1bd80b6802c6df5e7b523e)

commit_message:
Add functional recreate test of deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling

This is another wrinkle for bug 1404867 where we create a
volume-backed server, create an attachment on the volume which
puts the volume in 'attaching' status, and then delete the server
before it's actually created in a cell.

In this case, the _delete_while_booting code in the compute API
finds and deletes the BuildRequest before the instance was ever
created in a cell.

The bug is that _delete_while_booting in the API doesn't also
process block device mappings and unreserve/delete attachments
on the volume, which orphans the volume and can only be fixed
with admin intervention in the block storage service.

Change-Id: Ib65acc671711eae7aee65df9cd5c6b2ccb559f5c
Related-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit 08f0f71a83ff75c5439e72f0913c5feabe2972ed)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 16:16:12.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None and vm_state = ERROR which may
have ports and volumes still allocated.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when it may have
ports or volumes allocated.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return. This is
     the "delete while booting" scenario.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR because of a failed build or is
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we expect instance.host to be None even though
     there could be ports or volumes allocated. In this case, run the
     _local_delete routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the
     instance database record.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None and vm_state = ERROR which may
have ports and volumes still allocated.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when it may have
ports or volumes allocated.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return. This is
     the "delete while booting" scenario.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR because of a failed build or is
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we expect instance.host to be None even though
     there could be ports or volumes allocated. In this case, run the
     _local_delete routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the
     instance database record.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/55ea961/nova/compute/manager.py#L1927-L1929

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117
(cherry picked from commit b3f39244a3eacd6fb141de61850cbd84fecdb544)

commit_message:
Add functional tests to ensure BDM removal on delete

In certain cases, such as when an instance fails to be scheduled,
the volume may already have an attachment created (or the volume
has been reserved in the old flows).

This patch adds a test to check that these volume attachments
are deleted and removed once the instance has been deleted. It
also adds some functionality to allow checking when an volume
has been reserved in the Cinder fixtures.

Change-Id: I85cc3998fbcde30eefa5429913ca287246d51255
Related-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit 20edeb362327ea9448d38b6e2bcb03e0a71060d0)

[{'created': '2018-02-19 21:35:58.000000000', 'message': "Lazy-load instance attributes with read_deleted=yes

If we're doing a lazy-load of a generic attribute on instance, we
should be using read_deleted=yes. Otherwise we just fail in the load
process which is confusing and not helpful to a cleanup routine that
needs to handle the deleted instance. This makes us load those things
with read_deleted=yes.

(cherry picked from commit 6ba8a35825a7ec839b2d0aab7559351d573130ab)
"}]
commit_message:
Lazy-load instance attributes with read_deleted=yes

If we're doing a lazy-load of a generic attribute on instance, we
should be using read_deleted=yes. Otherwise we just fail in the load
process which is confusing and not helpful to a cleanup routine that
needs to handle the deleted instance. This makes us load those things
with read_deleted=yes.

Change-Id: Ide6cc5bb1fce2c9aea9fa3efdf940e8308cd9ed0
Closes-Bug: #1745977
(cherry picked from commit 6ba8a35825a7ec839b2d0aab7559351d573130ab)

commit_message:
Update plugs Contrail methods to work with privsep

As privsep uses the msgpack to send method arguments to the privsep
daemon, we could not use anymore custom data type like
nova.objects.instance.Instance.

Change-Id: I09f04d5b2f1cb39339ad7c4569186db5d361797a
Closes-Bug: #1742963
(cherry picked from commit 1f5fe3190bf2e0987945a6ef9ec430673c9fa736)

[WIP] Update provider parameter in the creating volume command

This patch set is to update the creating command
with provider parameter, from "nova.volume.encryptors.luks.LuksEncryptor"
to "luks".

Other hand, it is to test the grenade_devstack_barbican gate.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 22:10:33.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I85aae7b1dbfe061e75900d25e4fcc366ab20a0d9
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I85aae7b1dbfe061e75900d25e4fcc366ab20a0d9

commit_message:
Store block device mappings in cell0

If an instance fails to get scheduled, it gets buried in cell0 but
none of it's block device mappings are stored.  At the API layer,
Nova reserves and creates attachments for new instances when
it gets a create request so these attachments are orphaned if the
block device mappings are not registered in the database somewhere.

This patch makes sure that if an instance is being buried in cell0,
all of it's block device mappings are recorded as well so they can
be later removed when the instance is deleted.

Change-Id: I64074923fb741fbf5459f66b8ab1a23c16f3303f
Related-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit ad9e2a568fcef4f69b185952352db9f651c37ad4)

stop console when unnecessary

When node was deleted, the console process should be stopped

commit_message:
Drop extra loop which modifies Cinder volume status

There is an existing loop which sets the proper value for status
and attach_status right above, so this is doing nothing other than
changing it to the incorrect value.

Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: Iea0c1ea0a699b9519f66977391202956f17aac66
(cherry picked from commit 8cd64670ea23484fd1e1a8883e9841486169363e)

Closes-Bug: #1750767

commit_message:
Fix unit tests to make py36 happy

There are some corner cases where py36 expects dicts to be presented in
a peculiar way. This patch fixes such problems.

Change-Id: I37bd7ad29eaf4b873f3118c6ab8b37bbf76b31a3
Closes-Bug: #1750767

messages:
[{'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:28:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-15 16:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 09:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 09:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 10:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-16 11:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Interesting question: the naming guidelines in the zuul v3 migration guide (https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#v3-naming) states:

The general pattern is {prefix-}MAINPURPOSE-DETAILS{-}{node}.

and also:

Use consistent names like “integration”, “functional”, “rally”, “tempest”, “grenade”, “devstack” (what do we need? Those should be explained) as MAINPURPOSE.

but this part seems new, so for example I defined my jobs as sahara-tests-tempest, because I tried not to pollute the global namespace by starting with the repository name. Can you please double check with the zuul team if the jobs should really be tempest-kuryr-kubernetes-foo or kuryr-kubernetes-foo ? I will try as well.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 11:14:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Hey @tosky, I do totally agree. I've added that as a topic for the Kuryr-Kubernetes / Infra-QA Session on Mon at https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kuryr-ptg-rocky

Feel free to add further questions and come along with us ;)"}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 11:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 11:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 11:50:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 13:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-16 21:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:42:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think I've debugged openshift gates, see inline."}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)

My concern with current change is that any new gates will be added into single zuul.yaml file. Is there any option to split to make it more maintainable in the future?'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

We can always create a .zuul.d directory and split the jobs in some files. i.e. 
* zuul.d/kuryr_kubernetes.yaml
* zuul.d/01_kuryr_jobs.yaml
* zuul.d/02_kuryr_jobs-variants.yaml
and so'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Please see dragonflow gate comment on patchset 23'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:40:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

Already added q-trunk ;) let's see how the gate behaves"}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-02-19 18:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > My concern with current change is that any new gates will be added
 > into single zuul.yaml file. Is there any option to split to make it
 > more maintainable in the future?

Fair point. We should probably use `zuul.d` or `.zuul.d` directory format [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/zuul/user/config.html#configuration-items'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-19 20:27:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 07:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:31:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

See comments from PS28. LGTM besides some job movements between queues that you've did."}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 11:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 11:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:28:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31: Code-Review+1

LGTM.

Multinode jobs have some issues, e.g. kubernetes-api is running on both controller and compute1 nodes. But I'm not opposed to merge them in this state as experimental."}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:31:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

Michal, yeah, that's a limitation from the current Zuul V3. There's no way of having subnode selection... I really do hope to get that sorted out during the PTG so we can test a proper multinode after it. As of now, it's just there on experimental so we can check how it would be ;)"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:12:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31: Code-Review-1

Oh, sorry, I've noticed something. AJaeger changed our jobs names a while ago. See [1]. I guess it's better to follow that convention.

[1] I3f49442a097b8290e75d12a939a1e65528263cec"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Ah, that solves the question that I asked earlier; I didn't notice the part about "If you define a job in a specific repo, the name of the job should use the repository name as prefix or as first part of it.".'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:37:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

@Andreas, could you please comment on the naming side, seems like there's some question related to that. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Fine in general.

-1 for the names.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

btw. experimental jobs are implicit non-voting, so no need to make them non-voting.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:45:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

@Andreas, that document states an example.

gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh -> tempest-neutron-full-ssh

That's where I take the naming from. Should I assume it's just the opposite."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Daniel, that example is for *shared* jobs defined in openstack-zuul-jobs.

Check the lines above:

"Since Zuul v3 allows overriding of job and definition of jobs, care should be taken not to use the same name for different jobs:

    If you override a generic Zuul job for global OpenStack usage, name it openstack-.
    *If you define a job in a specific repo, the name of the job should use the repository name as prefix or as first part of it.*"'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review+1

Naming looks fine, structure of zuul.yaml is fine.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-02-21 05:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-02-21 07:54:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-02-21 08:30:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Thanks for the refactor Dani! I just have a few nits/comments'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-21 08:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-02-21 08:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review+1

fair enough'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-02-21 13:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-02-21 13:58:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 32: Code-Review+2

Let's get this in, as this was already the behavior before. But we should remove neutron-lbaas from octavia gates."}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-02-22 05:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 13:38:23.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor Kuryr-Kubernetes gates to Zuul-V3

This commit refactors the Kuryr-Kubernetes gates to Zuul-V3 native

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.

requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iad4b11c3c625d7c2401d7d8debd29534ada9ae4a

[{'created': '2018-02-21 14:06:53.000000000', 'message': 'Services: Set missing SGs for haproxy provider

Since we started using Octavia we never got around to setting the
security groups for the legacy haproxy provider. This only affects when
using the native firewall as otherwise the haproxy internal ovs port
bypasses the SGs

Change-Id: Ie4a53dedf54472394f92fdfacddf0632e33f1f5b
Closes-Bug: 1749968
Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>

(cherry picked from commit c9041d6979928c0690f8dd913facab8ae3dcc0fd)
'}]
commit_message:
Services: Set missing SGs for haproxy provider

Since we started using Octavia we never got around to setting the
security groups for the legacy haproxy provider. This only affects when
using the native firewall as otherwise the haproxy internal ovs port
bypasses the SGs

Change-Id: Ie4a53dedf54472394f92fdfacddf0632e33f1f5b
Closes-Bug: 1749968
Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
(cherry picked from commit c9041d6979928c0690f8dd913facab8ae3dcc0fd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 09:59:47.000000000', 'message': 'Support OpenShift 3.7 in DevStack plugin

commit_message:
Run OpenShift 3.7.1 in DevStack plugin

This commit does necessary changes in DevStack plugin to support
OpenShift in 3.7.1 version and switches URL to that version.

Change-Id: I18d7c97090570811d509b9574d747ea526695b6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 09:11:36.000000000', 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: Id4b47eeae1d3e86a3cb259c32fcb376ffbd3f8c7
'}]
commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: Id4b47eeae1d3e86a3cb259c32fcb376ffbd3f8c7

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I9e854aa9688f04bf395d91ad9568909d020740e7

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I379857b0ef8cd34a618bd8409d26a61bf6eca6b2
(cherry picked from commit cbdaa577c470de2ac4418162f3397817d8255cb7)

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_plugin option

Option "auth_plugin" is deprecated, use option "auth_type" instead.

Change-Id: I0da3415ada2c17d8faa78ff4ed9e50353b6915ef
Implements: blueprint deprecate-auth-plugin
(cherry picked from commit 3ec93b9c3d3baa0cd206477e58e5dd1db403e794)

commit_message:
Allow host URL for versions to be configurable

The versions resource constructs the links by using application_url,
but it's possible that the API endpoint is behind a load balancer
or SSL terminator. This means that the application_url might be
incorrect. This fix provides a config option (similar to other
services) which lets us  override the host URL when constructing
links for the versions API.

Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I23f06c6c2d52ba46c74e0d097c4963d2de731d30
Closes-bug: 1384379

commit_message:
Add nova-cells docker building file (for those that use cells v1 or v2)

Refer to the following for understanding what nova-cells is.

http://docs.openstack.org/newton/config-reference/compute/cells.html

Partially Implements: blueprint support-nova-cells

Change-Id: Iafa28fbc4d2a2da5bcc69c0d58d39cf76ef2d952

commit_message:
Stubs the loading of namespace in config-agent unit tests.

When oslo-config accesses the definition of a namespace, it uses stevedore to get
an entry point that list available options. We stub this function so that even
if the entry point is in congress, we do not relie on this mechanism.

Release-team: very low risk fix of testing code

Change-Id: I73d05056336ca4cc44fddd887064af3bd9fe9be3
Closes-Bug: #1750190

commit_message:
Stubs the loading of namespace in config-agent unit tests.

When oslo-config accesses the definition of a namespace, it uses stevedore to get
an entry point that list available options. We stub this function so that even
if the entry point is in congress, we do not relie on this mechanism.

Change-Id: I73d05056336ca4cc44fddd887064af3bd9fe9be3
Closes-Bug: #1750190

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 22:17:53.000000000', 'message': 'Check if attachment_id exists before deleting it

There is a case where the block device mapping might not be in
the database if there are any computes running Ocata or before
because the data is only persisted in the API layer when using
the new attachment flow.

This patch makes sure to check if there is an attachment_id
to avoid raising exceptions due to it not being dynamically
loaded and fixes the functional test aswell.

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
'}, {'created': '2018-02-21 02:45:40.000000000', 'message': 'Check if attachment_id exists before deleting it

There is a case where the block device mapping might not be in
the database if there are any computes running Ocata or before
because the data is only persisted in the API layer when using
the new attachment flow.

This patch makes sure to check if there is an attachment_id
to avoid raising exceptions due to it not being dynamically
loaded and fixes the functional test aswell.

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
'}, {'created': '2018-02-21 15:33:08.000000000', 'message': 'Check if attachment_id exists before deleting it

There is a case where the block device mapping might not be in
the database if there are any computes running Ocata or before
because the data is only persisted in the API layer when using
the new attachment flow.

This patch makes sure to check if there is an attachment_id
to avoid raising exceptions due to it not being dynamically
loaded and fixes the functional test aswell.

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
'}, {'created': '2018-02-21 15:46:05.000000000', 'message': "Ensure attachment_id always exists for block device mapping

If an instance is deleted before it is scheduled, the BDM
clean-up code uses the mappings from the build request as
they don't exist in the database yet.

When using the older attachment flow with reserve_volume,
there is no attachment_id bound to the block device mapping
and because it is not loaded from database but rather from
the build request, accessing the attachment_id field raises
an exception with 'attachment_id not lazy-loadable'

If we did a new style attach, _validate_bdm will add the
attachment_id from Cinder.  If we did not, then this patch
will make sure to set it to 'None' to avoid raising an
exception when checking if we have an attachment_id set in
the BDM clean-up code

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
"}, {'created': '2018-02-21 19:29:44.000000000', 'message': "Ensure attachment_id always exists for block device mapping

commit_message:
Ensure attachment_id always exists for block device mapping

If an instance is deleted before it is scheduled, the BDM
clean-up code uses the mappings from the build request as
they don't exist in the database yet.

When using the older attachment flow with reserve_volume,
there is no attachment_id bound to the block device mapping
and because it is not loaded from database but rather from
the build request, accessing the attachment_id field raises
an exception with 'attachment_id not lazy-loadable'

If we did a new style attach, _validate_bdm will add the
attachment_id from Cinder.  If we did not, then this patch
will make sure to set it to 'None' to avoid raising an
exception when checking if we have an attachment_id set in
the BDM clean-up code

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666

commit_message:
Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)

commit_message:
Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)

commit_message:
Enable tempest-full on stable/pike

Add stable/pike on tempest-full.
The job will be voting on stable/pike so we need bitrot
jobs on Tempest master as well. Not the py3 since it was
not running on Pike yet.

Once this lands we can add bitrot jobs to d-g as well,
and filter the legacy job out of pike in the integrated
templates.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/545258/
Change-Id: I1ac0e54eab22786575e11f4d34b7e15e643038c4

commit_message:
Bump OpenStack service version

* Bump aodh from 5.0.0 to 5.1.0
* Bump bifrost from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1
* Bump ceilometer from 9.0.3 to 9.0.4
* Bump cinder from 11.0.2 to 11.1.0
* Bump congress from 6.0.0 to 6.0.1
* Bump glance from 15.0.0 to 15.0.1
* Bump heat from 9.0.2 to 9.0.3
* Bump ironic from 9.1.2 to 9.1.3
* Bump ironic-ui from 3.0.1 to 3.0.2
* Bump ironic-inspector from 6.0.0 to 6.0.1
* Bump mistral from 5.2.0 to 5.2.2
* Bump mistral-dashboard from 5.2.0 to 5.2.2
* Bump networking-ovn from 3.0.0 to 3.0.1
* Bump nova from 16.0.4 to 16.1.0
* Bump panko from 3.0.0 to 3.1.0
* Bump sahara from 7.0.0 to 7.0.2
* Bump sahara-dashboard from 7.0.0 to 7.0.2
* Bump tacker from 0.8.0 to 0.8.1
* Bump vmtp from 2.4.4 to 2.4.5

Change-Id: Ia2f568a1b4e55a62337e702b028f34188a926f4f

Change-Id: Ib6a5eb7b4055e422d5f2c550c22ba7b9afb66d47

commit_message:
Stop running grenade in Ocata

Since newton is end of life, we can't run grenade
on ocata changes since there is no newton branch from
which to start the grenade run.

Change-Id: Ib6a5eb7b4055e422d5f2c550c22ba7b9afb66d47

[{'created': '2018-02-21 20:45:09.000000000', 'message': 'Hide Pike note on Queens Release Notes page

The pike-rc-2 release note was merged to master after the
stable/pike branch was cut and is appearing on the Queens
Release Notes page.  Take advantage of the reno ignore-notes
feature to hide it in Queens.  (It is still displayed on the
Pike Release Notes page, as it should be.)

Change-Id: Ib56104ecf3f94eec56e144a9ea6569fa9bf14b8e
'}]
commit_message:
Hide Pike note on Queens Release Notes page

The pike-rc-2 release note was merged to master after the
stable/pike branch was cut and is appearing on the Queens
Release Notes page.  Take advantage of the reno ignore-notes
feature to hide it in Queens.  (It is still displayed on the
Pike Release Notes page, as it should be.)

Change-Id: Ib56104ecf3f94eec56e144a9ea6569fa9bf14b8e

As stated on PS3, we only want to ignore the code for “wrong device” aka “not found”. The rationale is that if the device is already disconnected, that’s okay, ignore and continue. If it fails for any other reason, there is a real problem. So other than exit code 4, we should reraise and avoid telling cinder to terminate the connection if the disconnect through os-brick failed.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-12-08 15:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-25 10:04:04.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

In case users try an other attempt to detach volume we should not stop
the process whether the device is not found in domain definition but
try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

In case users try an other attempt to detach volume we should not stop
the process whether the device is not found in domain definition but
try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Closes-Bug: #1727260
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make the apache-logs-conf role even less verbose

Round 2 to add no_log to more things. Specific looping over stats, it
is pretty noise in logs and doesn't seem to add any value.

Change-Id: I580171e0061fa331f3ed510713f1ac7a1a6cb5ea
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)

commit_message:
Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 17:50:50.000000000', 'message': 'Support expand->migrate->contract db migrations

In order to support rolling upgrades, OpenStack services
are moving to a trigger driven approach to db upgrade,
involving expand, migrate and contract phases.

This requires that the underlying db supports creation of
such triggers which requires that:

  log_bin_trust_function_creators = 1

in the MySQL global configuration.

Change-Id: Id2cf2dd5a0929270229541e6cd488cd1c0d6103e
Closes-Bug: 1750705
'}]
commit_message:
Support expand->migrate->contract db migrations

In order to support rolling upgrades, OpenStack services
are moving to a trigger driven approach to db upgrade,
involving expand, migrate and contract phases.

This requires that the underlying db supports creation of
such triggers which requires that:

  log_bin_trust_function_creators = 1

in the MySQL global configuration.

Change-Id: Id2cf2dd5a0929270229541e6cd488cd1c0d6103e
Closes-Bug: 1750705

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: Ia759c43b11f76c0fa6862aece824360a45419985
Closes-Bug: #1693670

messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-09 14:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-09 17:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23360, 'date': '2018-02-11 01:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27346, 'date': '2018-02-11 01:54:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27366, 'date': '2018-02-11 01:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27370, 'date': '2018-02-11 02:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27552, 'date': '2018-02-11 05:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-12 12:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:29:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

wait for response to Gary's concern"}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Gary, please remember this is just deprecation, it is not removal or disablement of the neutron-lbaas code. You will be able to continue to use neutron-lbaas until the deprecation cycle ends, which per OpenStack policy will be at least two release cycles in the future.
As the FAQ states, there will be migration tools provided during the Rocky cycle.
The point of deprecation is to announce that new features will no longer be accepted for neutron-lbaas and that folks need to start planning for a migration, at least two cycles in the future.
This was all announce a year and a half ago when the specification was merged for neutron.
Please see the FAQ for these details and more information.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, please note, the deprecation has already occurred (in the neutron-lbaas code, announced on the mailing lists, etc). This is just documenting that fact in the neutron API documentation.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-15 06:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Neutron patch has also landed. This still concerns me. I will not block this'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-15 06:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The neutron patch has landed in Rocky. I do not think that this should be in stable.
If someone want to override then feel free.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-22 01:54:54.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This doesn't matter, the API ref isn't versioned.  Abandoning as it is already posted."}]

commit_message:
Delete the duplicated default_config_files defiend

when use instance as fuction, python will invoke the __call__, and in
oslo.config, the default_config_files is defined as None [0], so it
is unnecessary to defined again in freezer, this patch to remove it.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2450

Change-Id: I7d017c8f92568c5849fde2a65065970901122620

[{'created': '2018-02-19 22:04:46.000000000', 'message': "Pause container before doing commit

Docker daemon will pause the container being committed if we don't
pause the container. However, this will lead to inconsistency
between Docker daemon and DB (the container's state is Running in
DB but Paused in Docker). Although the inconsistency will be
converged in periodic task, we can do better by explicitly pausing
the container before doing the commit and unpause the container
after. This will keep the container's state consistent during and
after commit and avoid bug like #1749879.

Change-Id: Ie872e71e386714b791f3277fcdb2326e09235128
Related-Bug: #1749879
"}, {'created': '2018-02-21 03:33:43.000000000', 'message': "Pause container before doing commit

between Docker daemon and DB (the container's state is Running in
DB but Paused in Docker). Although the inconsistency will be
converged in periodic task, we can do better by explicitly pausing
the container before doing the commit and unpause the container
after. This will keep the container's state consistent during and
after commit and avoid bug like #1749879.

Change-Id: Ie872e71e386714b791f3277fcdb2326e09235128
Related-Bug: #1749879

commit_message:
Pause container before doing commit

Docker daemon will pause the container being committed if we don't
pause the container. However, this will lead to inconsistency
between Docker daemon and DB (the container's state is Running in
DB but Paused in Docker). Although the inconsistency will be
converged in periodic task, we can do better by explicitly pausing
the container before doing the commit and unpause the container
after. This will keep the container's state consistent during and
after commit and avoid bug like #1749879.

Change-Id: Ie872e71e386714b791f3277fcdb2326e09235128
Related-Bug: #1749879

subject: Fix occasional Tempest failures with invalid tokens
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-21 20:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-22 00:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 20:26:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix occasional Tempest failures with invalid tokens

The current fernet rotation happens every 5 minutes with a token
expiry of 40 minutes.   This means that after 15 minutes, all
tokens are expired.  This causes Nova to fail for some operations
because it's tokens are now expired.

This adjusts the maximum active keys to 5 and rotation every 10
minutes which will mean that we'll rotate at least once during
the tempest runs which lasts around 15 minutes while keeping all
tokens valid for the entire 40 minutes.

Change-Id: I0e3056aa00a260a93872508dd0158c15060cda19
(cherry picked from commit e2eb1ff97daf302d143f20144a77ee3a50f90a0b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix occasional Tempest failures with invalid tokens

The current fernet rotation happens every 5 minutes with a token
expiry of 40 minutes.   This means that after 15 minutes, all
tokens are expired.  This causes Nova to fail for some operations
because it's tokens are now expired.

This adjusts the maximum active keys to 5 and rotation every 10
minutes which will mean that we'll rotate at least once during
the tempest runs which lasts around 15 minutes while keeping all
tokens valid for the entire 40 minutes.

Change-Id: I0e3056aa00a260a93872508dd0158c15060cda19
(cherry picked from commit e2eb1ff97daf302d143f20144a77ee3a50f90a0b)

subject: Stop shipping object rows when we only want shards
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-09-28 21:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2017-09-29 06:21:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tim and I discussed this in channel. And this isn't quite what we want. We want to still send data if the replica is in the sharding state, and only stop sending if its in the unsharded state."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-09-29 18:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

As long as the sender includes a "hey, I'm currently sharding" message in that initial request, I think we can do a bit better...'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-22 01:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I *think* this will mostly be superseded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545082/?'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-28 21:31:19.000000000', 'message': 'Stop shipping object rows when we only want shards

It makes me nervous that we're always using usync regardless of how much
we've diferged from the other replicas. At the same time, we definitely
*can't* go using rsync -- the whole premise is that these DBs have
gotten too big for that!

Now, if we detect that we're in a different sharding state than the
remote, just send "other items" (i.e., the shard ranges). This keeps us
from pushing more rows into an already-big DB while also making the
probe test easier to reason about.

Change-Id: I01ebb341ff064a3983280c568ce0763081899783
'}]
commit_message:
Stop shipping object rows when we only want shards

It makes me nervous that we're always using usync regardless of how much
we've diferged from the other replicas. At the same time, we definitely
*can't* go using rsync -- the whole premise is that these DBs have
gotten too big for that!

Now, if we detect that we're in a different sharding state than the
remote, just send "other items" (i.e., the shard ranges). This keeps us
from pushing more rows into an already-big DB while also making the
probe test easier to reason about.

Change-Id: I01ebb341ff064a3983280c568ce0763081899783

So, it's still possible to race here, but this patch reduces the window in which it can happen.

I think the real fix is for ironic to detach tenant ports at tear down.

That said, this does help, and I expect some debate on the detach thing. So I'm good with landing (and backporting) this for now. Thanks hshiina!"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-21 15:16:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Yeah, it's probably better than nothing. Thanks Hironori, good catch."}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-02-21 16:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- dell-hw14G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-idrac https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/84/546584/1/check/dell-hw14G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-idrac/aa20acf/ : FAILURE in 45m 02s
- dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/84/546584/1/check/dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool/3741e44/ : FAILURE in 45m 50s'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:09:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This doesn't totally solve the problem. Are folks ok with the possible few exceptions to this... ?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I had a quick discussion with dmitry about this, and what the ramifications are if even one VIF got restored. Is the below correct? If so, then I'm not sure we should do this. (On the other hand, I forgot why we removed the lock; I think it caused some other failure? So do we need to weigh the two evils and choose one?)

12:11 rloo: dtantsur: what are the ramifications if the tenant_vif_port_id is accidentally restored?
12:11 dtantsur: rloo: it will mean restoring the VIF if I get it right
12:12 rloo: dtantsur: right, which means... ?? we cannot attach another vif?
12:12 dtantsur: rloo: yep, I guess this port is "occupied"
12:13 rloo: dtantsur: that would be bad then. since eg, this is in cleaning, the node is getting ready to be used again. by another tenant or whatever.
12:13 dtantsur: correct'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

btw, good catch Hironori!'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We discussed in irc [1] and decided to revert the original patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546705/1

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2018-02-21.log.html#t2018-02-21T16:53:22'}, {'account_id': 13689, 'date': '2018-02-22 01:19:12.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

As mentioned, this patch doesn't completely solve the problem. I agree to revert the original patch.

Thanks."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 12:31:15.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh port before storing VIF ID for cleaning

While a node is being connected to a cleaning network for automated
cleaning after tearing down, tenant VIFs may be detached by the Compute
Service because VIFs can be detached without locking a node. When a VIF
is detached, its UUID is removed from internal_info of a port. However,
a task for cleaning may have this UUID in its port object. This
remaining VIF UUID may be restored when the cleaning task stores a VIF
for cleaning network.

This patch refreshes a port object before storing a VIF for cleaning to
mitigate this race condition.

Change-Id: I8f8ea9ffb40b096f9ee74f28fb2405f3a59ac263
Closes-Bug: 1750785
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh port before storing VIF ID for cleaning

While a node is being connected to a cleaning network for automated
cleaning after tearing down, tenant VIFs may be detached by the Compute
Service because VIFs can be detached without locking a node. When a VIF
is detached, its UUID is removed from internal_info of a port. However,
a task for cleaning may have this UUID in its port object. This
remaining VIF UUID may be restored when the cleaning task stores a VIF
for cleaning network.

This patch refreshes a port object before storing a VIF for cleaning to
mitigate this race condition.

Change-Id: I8f8ea9ffb40b096f9ee74f28fb2405f3a59ac263
Closes-Bug: 1750785

IIUC the old heat plugin (from the heat_integrationtests directory in the openstack/heat repo) was named 'heat_plugin', but this new one is just named 'heat'.

So I wonder if the correct fix isn't to change the default to False, but to rename the option from 'heat_plugin' to 'heat'?"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-21 11:14:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Set CONF.service_available.heat_plugin default to False

CONF.service_available.heat_plugin is not used now and it
may cause tempest identity testcase test_list_endpoints_for_token
fail, so this is to set its default to False.

Change-Id: I7e13cc68b0ab73d42724f70985cbd6708d4b8a77
Closes-Bug: #1742888

commit_message:
Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)

commit_message:
Do not use the 3rd argument of yaql groupBy

Due to an incompatible change in yaql, it's hard to use the aggregration
of groupBy as the behavior is completely different depending on the
version. Let's try to not rely on it.

Change-Id: I2887011f6baf4867d422579b116b5e143acf5679
Related-Bug: #1750032
(cherry picked from commit 0ddfff79ee5a5f62bb6de55b873bd16b811905f3)
(cherry picked from commit 677c4c221696b16d10ac80709af4be49e6e334c2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 06:54:14.000000000', 'message': "Pass the orignal network with segments to mechanism drivers

This is to pass the orignal network with segments
to mechanism drivers,because some mechanism drivers
need to handle segments change indeed.

For bug 1674840:
In the function delete_network:
it send related deletion events of resources.NETWORK
in the following order:
  events.BEFORE_DELETE-> events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE
  -> events.AFTER_DELETE
Then delete_segment was triggered on the event events.BEFORE_DELETE.

In the function delete_segment:
it send related deletion events of resources.SEGMENT
in the following order:
  events.BEFORE_DELETE-> events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE
  -> events.AFTER_DELETE
Then Ml2Plugin:_handle_segment_change was triggered on the event
events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE and events.AFTER_DELETE.

In _handle_segment_change, _notify_mechanism_driver_for_segment_change
is triggered and the orignal network is passed to md's update_network_precommit
and update_network_postcommit here.
Besides, the events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE is moved to be sended before the
segment deletion.

Change-Id: Ib3eedad6b6dd34537bfecb9a00cdf778e8c3f04e
Closes-bug: 1674840
"}, {'created': '2017-11-08 09:33:16.000000000', 'message': "Pass the orignal network with segments to mechanism drivers

This is to pass the orignal network with segments
to mechanism drivers,because some mechanism drivers
need to handle segments change indeed.

it send related deletion events of resources.NETWORK
in the following order:
  events.BEFORE_DELETE-> events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE
  -> events.AFTER_DELETE
Then delete_segment was triggered on the event events.BEFORE_DELETE.

In the function delete_segment:
it send related deletion events of resources.SEGMENT
in the following order:
  events.BEFORE_DELETE-> events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE
  -> events.AFTER_DELETE
Then Ml2Plugin:_handle_segment_change was triggered on the event
events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE and events.AFTER_DELETE.

In _handle_segment_change, _notify_mechanism_driver_for_segment_change
is triggered and the orignal network is passed to md's update_network_precommit
and update_network_postcommit here.
Besides, the events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE is moved to be send before the
segment deletion.

Change-Id: Ib3eedad6b6dd34537bfecb9a00cdf778e8c3f04e
Closes-bug: 1674840
"}]
commit_message:
Pass the orignal network with segments to mechanism drivers

This is to pass the orignal network with segments
to mechanism drivers,because some mechanism drivers
need to handle segments change indeed.

For bug 1674840:
In the function delete_network:
it send related deletion events of resources.NETWORK
in the following order:
  events.BEFORE_DELETE-> events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE
  -> events.AFTER_DELETE
Then delete_segment was triggered on the event events.BEFORE_DELETE.

In the function delete_segment:
it send related deletion events of resources.SEGMENT
in the following order:
  events.BEFORE_DELETE-> events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE
  -> events.AFTER_DELETE
Then Ml2Plugin:_handle_segment_change was triggered on the event
events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE and events.AFTER_DELETE.

In _handle_segment_change, _notify_mechanism_driver_for_segment_change
is triggered and the orignal network is passed to md's update_network_precommit
and update_network_postcommit here.
Besides, the events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE is moved to be send before the
segment deletion.

Change-Id: Ib3eedad6b6dd34537bfecb9a00cdf778e8c3f04e
Closes-bug: 1674840

commit_message:
Add functional test for deleting BFV server with old attach flow

When creating a new instance and deleting it before it gets scheduled
with the old attachment flow (reserve_volume), the block device mappings
are not persisted to database which means that the clean up fails
because it tries to lookup attachment_id which cannot be lazy loaded.

This patch adds a (failing) functional test to check for this issue
which will be addressed in a follow-up patch.

Related-Bug: #1750666
Change-Id: I294c54e5a22dd6e5b226a4b00e7cd116813f0704

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 18:39:46.000000000', 'message': "Update tox debug env

Having no path in debug environment assumes the test path to be
neutron_tempest_plugin/tests which doesn't exists, so tox -e debug
debug fails complaining that neutron_tempest_plugin/tests isn't
importable. This patch fixes the test path for debug environment.

Change-Id: Iac685d4d4fcee357c40141acc79b2aac28bd535b
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox debug env

Having no path in debug environment assumes the test path to be
neutron_tempest_plugin/tests which doesn't exists, so tox -e debug
debug fails complaining that neutron_tempest_plugin/tests isn't
importable. This patch fixes the test path for debug environment.

Change-Id: Iac685d4d4fcee357c40141acc79b2aac28bd535b
